title: Attentive Attention - m4w
text:
I am a husband and father who enjoys receiving massage. I admire and value the sacred space created by practitioners, to heal the body and quiet the mind. Bodywork has proven integral to my well being, as both a pleasant and practical form of facilitated meditation.

But a massage isn't something I can afford to have often. So, instead of paying to feel this way, I'd rather massage others for free. Performing bodywork lets me repay the patience, generosity, and attention that I received on the table. Moreover, I gain a very different sense of myself, which is truly a gift all its own.

My offer is simple, straight forward, and easy to attain: have a body that you want massaged. We'll coordinate schedules, then meet once, or regularly. My intention is to heal, connect with, and relieve your physical body.

I am a professional Black male, in my late thirties, of average weight and height. My personality type (ENTP) emphasizes thinking over feeling, which explains this lengthy post and my pursuit of sensate connections. My wife understands me best of course, and is my rock in this endeavor. She recognizes my need to be used, tasked, and encouraged by women. Through this ad, she is allowing you to do just that.

I've offered my time and attention via Craigslist in the past, and may provide references - if not, testimonials. I'm available for 1 to 3 hour sessions, most evenings, weekends, and Fridays. You can visit my modest Berkeley studio, or I can travel to you, within 30 minutes of Lake Merritt. I own a portable table, use draping, and have been privileged to work with various body types, abilities and conditions.

Please note that I am merely a student of touch, with no formal training. If you have any relevant ailments or medically diagnosed concerns, you are strongly advised to inform me. I can research and prepare, but ultimately trust that you know your health best. Above all else, I encourage feedback, and will dutifully adjust my stroke for your comfort.

My style is an intuitive mix of Swedish, Esalen, Lomi Lomi, and Thai stretches. I'm also familiar with the sacrum, psoas, glutes, adductors, and some lymph systems. You're welcome to inquire about your preferred modality as well - learning them expands my capacity to serve. Whatever the request or preference, I aim to deliver what you need to relax.

I welcome all inquiries. The most common one asks why I do this for free. While there is no fee, your presence and attention are invaluable. Caring for others helps me focus, open up emotionally, and simply be grateful. Giving is a chance to be present, which allows me to see my own patterns and solve my own problems, more easily. Not only is money a hurdle to having these moments, it often diminishes their value.

I hope to have written enough that you might respond with the same confidence, good faith and gratitude that I've attempted to display. Should you reply, please include a reasonable introduction, and what you can about your unique massage goals, needs, and/or concerns. Simply include your photo if you would like mine, in kind. Otherwise, expect to voice verify or meet and greet before booking. Finally, title your response "somatic healing", so I might weed out spam.

Thank you for reading all of this through. Be well!

title: Tech geek chatting? tips, nostalgia? List of topics - t4w
text:
Believe it or not, I need some geeking. So let's see, random ideas for some idle talk. Keep in mind, I'm adding to this list as the post is up, so uh, it's not really a "gotta answer them all in one go" thing. Also, it's probably obvious I'm the software type not hardware, so there's that. Sorry. And yes, these topics actually sound interesting. I like to think about what I use, what can I say! 

* What's your favorite app that you completely hate?
* What's an app that you love, but if pressed, you'd admit it "was maybe just alright but didn't suck."

* Do you ever wonder if craigslist would be better or worse if the average user knew they could use wild cards and groups and ors in their craigslist searches? I probably shouldn't say that too loud, should I?

* Blast from your app past, what do you miss most?
* * To expand that: one YOU stopped using, and why? And what about one that was taken away from you? (And with something like this, sure, webapps, mobile apps, hypercard stacks.)
* Oh, ha: app that you used back in the day that you can't *believe* that you not only used, but used for a relatively long time. What were you thinking!? [1] 

* What's your current peeve that's super easy to fix and you keep to meaning, but you never do it in the moment, and then it's gone? What's the last one of those you fixed?
* What's an issue that you know you're never gonna solve. Like, you don't want to tell me because you'll afraid I'll offer help, but it will never help? Also see: my tabs.

* App you used to like in college, but seeing her fewer than 15 years later she's a *disaster*. Speaking of which:
- - iTunes, we need to have an intervention. Get your shit together, seriously. You're ruing your life. You're ruing a *lot* of people's lives. 

* You ever get a chunk of the way into telling someone a tip, only to realize it's *way* too complicated for them, but you're sorta committed? 

* App that you really know you need to invest more time into, where you're just scratching the surface? Maybe something you use everyday and still haven't unlocked, maybe something you've had for awhile and use like one feature from (hello Keyboard Maestro), maybe it's something brand new, or y'know, maybe it's emacs. 
* An app like that that where you've dumped a *lot* of energy into in that past? (hopefully you still use it?)
* App that you just cannot get to work for you. (IFTTT. smh)

* What's the last one or two keyboard shortcuts you learned and why?
* What's your favorite keyboard shortcut? 
* What keyboard shortcut makes you cringe when you see someone not use it?
* What's a pet peeve that was introduced in a newer version of some software that you use(d) all the time, but which is driving you nuts? (For me, it's the change in TextEdit so that command-d is no longer "don't save" -- it 100% broke TextEdit for me.)

* What's the last thing you set up that totally changed how you work? For me it's turning my left control key into a Hyper key like 3 years ago. Ask. It'll blow your mind. ;-) 


In terms of compatibility for where I've got the most to off and most to get, Mac and iOS, and I'm in more of a desktop/os x mindset today. Chrome, Evernote, Alfred, whatever you see in my menu bar there. The usually suspects, basically. I'm in a desktop/mac place right now, but do do linux, too. I've got some android devices, but I don't know that anything I'd say about them is even remotely novel.

t4t t4w t4m


[1] So it was my eWorld joke that reminded me of this and prompted that question: I used cyberdog -- CYBERDOG -- for like *literally* a year and a half. OpenDoc! Annnnnd, I'm totally playing in my own nostalgic memory sandbox right now, aren't I? I would be fairly shocked if ... like, 1%? would have heard about it?

You're wondering you can have it both ways - the thrill and excitement of an illicit affair and the safety and security of your relationship with your partner. Great news - you can.

Plus, I hope we can be adults when it's time to say goodbye I know I will be understanding of a ending of our secret relationship and kiss you on the cheek and thank you for the wonderful tomes and wish you the best in life. I promise absolute and total discretion...I don't need or want to know details about your life that you deem sensitive and I would never do anything to disclose our attachment to anyone. I have no trouble maintaining healthy boundaries with respect to your "real" life. This isn't my first time doing this so be assured that I know how to behave.

I want someone that shares my hypersensitivity on sexual safety...be assured that I am 100% disease-free and that I won't put you at risk. I require the same commitment from you.

Honesty facilitates intimacy, and having intimacy in this affair is important for me. It also facilitates the discretion and safety I mentioned above. . I will reciprocate :).

I'm a nice, normal person with a cool job and engaging hobbies.I love conversation, watching sports, gardening, running and cooking, etc. . I'm funny, affectionate, conscientious, polite, reliable, romantic, sensual, thoughtful...and very friendly. I am unlike the majority of guys on Craigslist: I can spell, use punctuation correctly, write complete and complex sentences(wish I felt the same in school!).

I'm easy to talk to, so if I've piqued your curiosity please drop me a line and let's chat further. I would be thrilled to speak with you. Happy to answer questions about myself and what I'm seeking (feel free to ask whatever you like), and of course, would love to hear about you. 

To let me know that you're a real person (and that you read the entire ad) please include the word " shall we" in the subject line of your reply. And in case you're wondering - if you are reading this ad, that means I'm still looking for a partner in crime.

title: Looking For a Squatchin' Partner Who Knows Something on the Subject... - m4w
text:
Hi.

First, this is a very peaceful, contemplative, and respectful practice of exploration. There is none of the nonsense you see on TV. The energy is very 'light', and is more about 'reverence' than anything else. Hard as it might be to believe, we have had some very unusual, and very unexpected success on a multitude of levels.

I have personally been doing this research for quite a few years now, and only been out in the field locally the last 3 to 4 years. Having headed out in the deep Marin terrain awhile back, a partner and myself discovered, quite by accident, some pretty compelling evidence of either visitations, or, outright habituation right here in the county. Having asked a few people I know I could trust, as well as using the BFRO website for historical references as to Marin events regarding possible Sasquatch incidents, there seems to be a very solid, and ongoing precedent for what we found. Unfortunately, the BFRO has taken down the references to any, and all Marin occurrences since they started the show 'Finding Bigfoot'. No surprise there, I guess. Anyway, it seems that some areas of the Marin watershed are indeed privy to visits in the same manner as is found in many parts of the greater north western states. 

My buddy John and myself are extremely grounded, fact and evidence based investigators when we have the time. Unfortunately, John has very little times these days to make these trips out to these 'Hot-Spots', as it were. Thus, I am looking for someone who has at least some knowledge of the subject, respects the subject at hand for what it is, and is also grounded, compassionate, caring, and respectful of the environment. Someone who can also remain 'Mum' on the areas in question. We do NOT seek any publicity, and prefer the findings of this research to remain within the circle of trusted people in the local community, of which there are very few thus far. I do however, share information on what we find with 2 of best investigators in the field. Again, in complete, non-public confidence.

Anyway, if you are interested in knowing more, and perhaps taking an excursion by car, or bike to some of the easier areas to explore where some great evidence has been found, then please write back to me with whatever you feel is appropriate that I should know about you. This is not an exclusive 'club' by any means. I can also assure anyone that the chances of a 'sighting' are basically zero. But, the vast area between upper Muir Woods, to the far end of Kent Lake in Lagunitas DO seem to have something very interesting going on on a fairly consistent basis. 

Please let me know your thoughts, experiences, ideas, even second-hand stories. The Sasquatch is not the only thing of a cryptid nature living in the hills of Marin as I, and many others have found out over the years. But, there is indeed some very fertile territory for new discovery along certain lines that the vast majority of people, even those interested in this subject, just know absolutely nothing about locally.

Look forward to hearing from you.

title: Gentle Soul desires walking/hiking friend - w4m
text:
Hello...There is joy to be found in a platonic friendship where both of us can just be ourselves with no need to pretend. I am a gentle, kind and pure-hearted woman who would like to share walks, hikes and mutually agreeable outings with another good soul. I am deeply connected with nature and find some of my best moments are in the woods nestled under a tree or perched on a beach cliff watching the pelicans as they sweep the wave crests. 

Please, if you would be so kind as to read my entire post before replying so that you may fully understand my proposal.

The mature gentleman friend I am searching for already takes walks and hikes not just for the exercise but for the connection that he feels to nature. He appreciates that there is more to this world than we can sense. He delights in the trees, plants and animals and stops to listen to the wind talk through the pines. He can put himself in another person's place and try to understand their point of view and appreciates their feelings. He understands that any one person cannot know everything and that there is something to be learned everyday and that change is a healthy part of nature. He sees that there is joy and hope to be found even though the world is full of suffering. He thinks for himself; doesn't trust blindly and knows that trust is earned. Finally, he understands that no man (or woman) is an island; we all need friends; and that true friendship is based on common spirit, trust and respect.

I am a simple woman who does not wear makeup, perfume or fancy clothes; I am most comfortable in my hiking boots and my trusty wool sweater. However, I am not a masculine woman...but things like clothes and jewelry just don't matter to me. My lineage is German/Scandanavian and I was born in April and I am 56 and 5'7". I prefer homemade food carried in my backpack over restaurants. I cook almost all my food from scratch including broth, stews, soups, kefir and beet kvass. I am very interested in natural healing and cooking healing foods. I was raised in the country/farmland with three brothers (all construction industry including my Father, Grandfathers and Uncles) among oak forests and cornfields and one very nice river with trout, bluegill and crappie. I like to fix things so I have a knack for taking things apart and putting them back together (most of the time!) My soul is kind and my heart is pure and I possess a keen intuition and intelligence; that is where my worth resides and I am at peace with myself. I love to laugh but not at anyone's expense. My favorite colors are blue, yellow, green, pink and purple and sometimes orange; yes, I'm kind of a rainbow woman. I love the feel of the wind, the smell of the forest floor and the touch of tree bark. I always choose the road less traveled :) 

Please accept my apologies if life's diversions, distractions and responsibilities keep me from answering your inquiry in a timely manner. And, if you would, please tell me a little bit about yourself, where you like to walk and hike, along with your favorite connecting with nature memory or story in your reply so I know you are serious and have understood my post. It is very difficult for me to reply to an email in which no substantial information is given. I take my safety very seriously, so please don't ask me to send a picture or to exchange phone numbers; a few informative emails can help build needed initial trust that could lead to a friendly public meeting. I am a real person and very well grounded in the pitfalls of human society. Although I genuinely miss the companionship of a man and a man's mature perspective, the only type of friendship I can offer is strictly platonic. I have no agenda other than sharing friendship through nature and would expect the same. Please note that I live on the peninsula and traffic is sadly a restricting factor on travel for a peaceful friendship. My regions of walking and hiking are from Marin County down to Santa Cruz and occasionally Monterey and Big Sur.

So if any of this precludes any further communication on your part, I understand. However, if this still resonates with you, and you would care to converse with me, please feel free to respond. Perhaps we may find that together we can enjoy a peaceful easy friendship. True friendship is a rare thing and, to me, is based on common spirit, respect and trust. There is so much joy in life; I believe it is meant to be shared. Sunny smiles to all.

title: In desperate need... - mw4m
text:
My husband and I are kind, responsible, well educated adults .We spent alot of time and effort building a stable life for ourselves. And now, somehow we have found ourselves in a really terrible situation we can't seem to get ourselves out of. My husband and myself are both native to Oregon, both raised in the mid valley. It has been our dream for the past couple years to move to California, and start a new life, in a place we both love. So about 6 months ago we decided it was time to make our dream a reality. My father died a few years back , and I have stayed in touch with several of his close friends. So when we decided it was time to start planning our move to California I called the only person I knew in the entire state. An old college friend of my father's, who I had always been particularly found of. He immediately offered to let us live with him in Richmond. He offered me a position as his caregiver in exchange for a monthly wage, and free rent. It sounded like an amazing opportunity, we exchanged pics of his home, and discussed in length the many aspects and details of the near future. And when the day came we packed our belongings, and headed south to begin our new life. When we arrived in Richmond, we realized immediately that we were NOT getting what we bargained for. My father's friend was a hoarder the entire floor was covered in well over a foot of garbage. The house was infested with mice and roaches, and the bedroom we were promised did not exist, instead there was a twin mattress for us, in the living room amoungst the garbage and clutter. It only got worse from there. The house had no water, no gas, no electricity, no heat. We should have immediately left, but instead we decided to try to help my father's Friend, and try to improve his way of life. We paid off his very outstanding debts with the utility companies, and had the electricity, water, and gas restored. My father's friend was incredibly difficult to live with. He was irritable and Moody constantly. He kept odd hours, making it very hard to sleep, as we were sleeping in the living room. There were odd people coming and going constantly, and little by little our belongings began to dissapear. Very quickly it became clear that my father's friend was a crack addict. The pay I was promised never came, and our savings had been used on the move,and to restore the utilities, and attempt to get the house cleaned up and into working order. Within 90 days we were broke. And very very unhappy with the our situation . we tried to talk to my father's friend, which made everything far worse . and in the past few weeks we have had every possession of any value stolen from us, my husband was mugged 
And hit in the head with a bat, our car was stolen, and the tempature dropped dramatically ..With no heat, no showers, no way to cook ... Life is pretty close to unbearable. There are drug addicts coming and going at all times, and I have never felt so unsafe or unsure in my life. I put a post up last week seeking help, but had no luck. 4 days ago I stumbled upon a letter that was sent to my father's friend. The home we live in is in the late stages of foreclosure
The letter stated that we would be removed by force on the 5th. We are stuck, we don't know a single person in the entire town. And we are about to lose everything we own and end up homeless in a town we don't feel safe in. We are desperate, and and without resources. We are hoping for a miracle. An opportunity to better our situation, or help getting back to Oregon if all else fails. We have no family to turn to. And we are lost, and unsure how to get ourselves out of this mess

title: Totes Cray - m4w
text:
Below is my list of the Top Ten Most Overused Phrases In Personal Ads. If YOUR ad does not contain any of the following phrases, please contact me immediately!

10) "I live life to the fullest!"

(Is this really the most profound philosophical statement you can come up with? Dig a little deeper, Nietzsche.)


9) "Loves to laugh" or "Fun-loving"

(Alright! A person who enjoys laughter and fun. What a rare individual; I must meet her at once. Just once I'd like to see "loves to sob uncontrollably for days on end.")


8) "I'm ____ years old but I look MUCH younger!"

(Sure you do. And if I just did a couple more sit-ups, I could still make the Giants starting lineup. Is self-delusion great or what?)


7) "I'm a down to earth..."

(If I see this phrase one more time, I'll... I'll... I don't know WHAT I'll do! I might be forced to actually turn off my computer and go interact with people in the REAL world. Okay, I probably wouldn't do anything THAT drastic. But you get the idea.)


6) "I can go from jeans to a cocktail dress in 10 minutes!"

(You must be very proud. I can't believe they haven't made this an Olympic event yet.)


5) "I'm a intelegent..."

(If you can't SPELL intelligent... do you see where I'm going with this? Class? Anyone?)


4) "I'm a typical (insert astrological sign here)."

(Astrology? Yeah, it's a science. I think they use it at NASA. I don't even know where to begin here. If you're looking for some insight into the nature of my character, don't ask me what my sign is. Talk to the Easter Bunny, he has the real inside track on me.)


3) "I don't have a pic, but trust me, you won't be disappointed!"

(Trust me, I will.)


2) "Looking for THE ONE" or "Looking for my Soulmate"

(Really? These are the most fresh and original lines you can come up with? Your mother and I had such high hopes for you. Oh well, there's always trade school.)


And the Number One Most Overused Phrase In A Personal Ad is...

1) "Don't worry, I plan to loose [sic] the weight real soon."

(Ok, it's probably just me, but why am I still worried?)


Put them all together, and the end result usually looks something like this....

"Fun-loving, down-to-earth woman with 5 kids from 5 different fathers seeks a intelegint guy who loves to laugh. Must be in shape! I'm temporarily 50 pounds overweight, but don't worry, I plan to loose the weight right after I finish these fries! Must look like Brad Pitt and be no older than 35! I'm 49 but I look MUCH younger! I don't have a pic, but trust me, you won't be disappointed! I'm a Libra so I live life to the fullest! I get along best with Geminis who have six-figure incomes! Must have a big heart and a bigger house, cuz the landlord just kicked us out!"

(Well, as long you have realistic expectations.)

my gf of the past 2 years with another guy. Sure I thought, "oh they are just friends". But as i'm walking over to approach them I see them kiss. So instead of causing a scene. So this brings me to Craigslist. I'm looking for a woman in her early 20s - early 30s who feels like taking a trip to Rome for v-day. I understand how crazy this must seem to some, but try putting yourself in my situation. I'm not looking for hook ups or anything, just someone cool to travel with. title: Join the Girlfriends Club SF - w4w

Welcome to the exclusive Girlfriends Club, where you are invited to join a league of girlfriends that fit your lifestyle and standards. Our goal is to help you find the perfect friend, shopping buddy, work out friend, or someone to hang and connect with. When you find out about great news or you are getting married or you need to cry on someone's shoulder about a break up, who do you call? You call a girlfriend! 

In a busy world today, it's hard to meet new girlfriends as an adult. We are busy with work and kids and going through the daily grind. You know how important having girlfriends is. Our job is intended for those who are looking for real long term friendship and helping you find them. Requirements to join: late twenties to late thirties that live in the the San Francisco Bay Area and be willing to have a photo of yourself on your profile. 

We believe finding a girlfriend is a lot like dating. You have to click. You may not click with everyone in the group, but all you need to do is meet a couple girlfriends that you "do" click with. It is our hope that some close friendships will be formed when you join. Single, married, those with kids (and without) are welcome to join. All I ask is that you are an active participant during your membership and leave the drama and cattiness behind. We form a meet up group once a month that may include movie nights, going out to dinner, spa days, going dancing, shopping, walks/bike rides, game nights and whatever else the group feels like doing. 

We are not looking for quantity, but quality and loyalty to friendship. We will be making sure every member is here for the right reasons and not to push products or lurk. 

Our time is important as we are sure yours is too, so a strict RSVP policy will be enforced. Privacy is important to us and we will make sure every member feels safe.

We are an exclusive social match making service exclusively for women members in San Francisco Bay Area. Each member is hand selected to connect with another member for one-on-one social meetings and invited to attend social club events. Our mission is to create long lasting relationships and create strong bonds between women. title: What If (revised) - w4m
text:
What if we could go back in time? I know, we hear this question a lot. But, I'm sure at some point, we all ponder it. The, "what ifs." What would we change, if anything at all?

I know I'd change some things. I'd find some courage to do what I haven't been able to do and even more courage to not do some things I've done. 

This is a random post, it's not intended for sex, meeting, falling in love or any of those intimate things. It's about a vent, to a stranger about some stupid shit you've done or haven't done. It's about not worrying if your pissed off, sad, a tad insane or just all around f'd up. No judgments, no names, no identification need be shared. 

I'm in a crappy spot in my life and I just want an ear. If you happen to have a funny bone, even better, because I tend to be sarcastic and I hide my flaws behind humor. Be around my perfect age of 48. I don't want to discuss the passing of Bowie, Natalie Cole or Frey and have you be puzzled as to who the hell I am talking about. Makes me feel old and this is about making ME feel better!!!

Yes, we can be selfish, so let's do it. Let's discuss what no one else wants to. Let's share secrets that no one else know, that would shock some, maybe even have them share their heads and walk away. Get things off our chest, so to speak. An outlet, hopefully a healthy one, cheaper than the psychiatrist we may need. We can make the net our padded room, scream, yell and even celebrate if the mood strikes.

Are you game?

Here's the revision:

I was fortunate enough to have had some great replies, but sometimes we get busy or things fizzle. I learned some things and you can't go wrong there. 

I wanted to say that I really didn't want to rant all about myself, so for those that offered an ear/eyes, I am appreciative, but this was a mutual venture. I started off my post with, "what ifs," yet I didn't really want to ponder those either, a bit counterproductive in some ways. I was merely pointing out we feel that way sometimes.

I'm married, I mentioned that or it was in one of those little boxes, but I need to reiterate. I also said this wasn't posted to meet, I don't even live in the Bay. Sorry....truly not looking to meet. 

I might not find anyone that I click with, but it's worth a shot. I just want to have a voice, but also listen to someone else and provide the same for them. I referred to Bowie, Cole, etc... more as a reference of things of my time. Don't really have a need to discuss their passing, as unfortunate as it was. We all know they are legends in they're own right. Age really isn't a factor, maturity is key and having some common ground.

Thanks again for your time! Good luck to all in search of something.....

"Look up to the sky.
You'll never find rainbows, 
if you're looking down."

Charlie Chaplin

title: Violinist and psychotherapist in training
text:
‎Update: I've been getting a lot of replies from men, so I just want to be really, really clear: I'm seeking women only. I'm not into guys, sorry. Really. Seriously. 

"Past the seeker as he prayed came the crippled and the beggar and the beaten. And seeing them...he cried, "Great God, how is it that a loving creator can see such things and yet do nothing about them?"...God said, "I did do something. I made you."" - Sufi Teaching

N.B. Kindness, sensitivity, openness, and compassion are paramount. All other priorities, I've found, are subject to change.

About me: High femme, violinist, teacher, and psychotherapist seeking gentle, contemplative, altruistic souls with whom to give richly, love deeply, and grow in unexpected ways.

A few possibly relevant details: I'm quiet (punctuated by bouts of exuberance), introspective, and a tad intense; I take things just a touch too seriously; I love children's books and kind humor; I'm compulsively affectionate; and I probably want to read poetry in bed with you on a rainy day. INFJ, if that matters to you. I'm at my happiest when I feel I am making the world a little better, and finding the goodness and beauty in everyone I encounter - which is not to say I am always successful in those endeavors! A little ice cream, a long date with my violin, a compassionate friend, or some cat videos are good salves for periods of more gritty humanness. 

What I'm doing with my life: loving my clients with a fierceness that awes me. Playing and teaching violin, volunteering with homeless children and as a crisis line counselor, and finishing a graduate degree in clinical social work. Putting off doing the laundry. Doing play therapy with children in the Oakland school district. Eating too much dessert. Believing in the fundamental goodness of all human beings. And nurturing my sense of transcendence and the divine.

"I slept and dreamt that life was joy
I awoke and saw that life was service
I acted and behold, service was joy."
-Tagore

My strengths: Willingness, empathizing, noticing people's strengths, losing at scrabble (actually, losing at MOST games, a quality which delights my little clients), being vulnerable with the people I trust, noticing and caring deeply about others' suffering and balancing that caring with hope, accepting constructive criticism, and admitting when I'm wrong. Well...most of the time! Oh. And walking in four-inch heels.

My weaknesses: Impulsive tendencies! Also, I'm a bit naive at times, with a tendency to assume honesty and good intentions - a quality I value in myself - and which occasionally gets in the way of my understanding where someone is really coming from! (If, for example, one of my clients is lying to me, I need to understand why, and help them address the feelings underlying said lie.)

You should message me if one of the following feels true:

-You're open-minded and care passionately about your fellow human beings
-You actively strive to make the world a better place
-You're deeply sensitive and often experience awe
-You like talking about feelings!!
-You regularly give your leftovers to the homeless
-You're open to friendship as well as dates, and you want to rock climb, play music, teach me to paint or tango, or make things together
-You're willing to open up and talk deeply about yourself
-You're monogamous
-You value spirituality/religion
-You love children
-You have a cat (or a kitten! Yay!) and will let me babysit
-You think it'd be fun to be friends with a future shrink
-Or you just want to. As Wendell Berry said, "It is not from ourselves that we learn to be better than we are."

title: Intellectual, Socially Conscious, Artsy?
text:
I am seeking the company of an intelligent woman. She doesn't have to have had climbed into the upper echelons of academia. I don't think academic success is a good measure of anyone's intelligence and much less their self-worth. But she should have wide intellectual interests and pursuits that include history, sociology, psychology, anthropology, social justice, journalism, historical and contemporary discourses concerning race, gender, sexuality and other social stigmas. She should not have a blind spot for intersectionality. She should be interested in advocacy efforts concerning stigma and structural and attitudinal prejudices. It is fine if she is irritated by the loaded label of "intellectual." I myself don't like it. But she should know she is intelligent. She should own it and try to do something powerful with it, for herself and the world.

I like someone who writes well, be it with a command for epigram like Wilde, or introspective and melodramatic prose like Proust, terse like Vonnegut, or endearingly bitter like Ginsberg. You should cherish detailed letters, text messages, and long conversations. You should be excited by wordplay. You should seem adorably smug after delivering a perfectly caustically witty joke and appreciate good comic timing. I myself am a better comedy writer than I am in delivered speech in person. I can be awkward and self-conscious in person. Hopefully some of that will come across as endearing.

I am philosophically opposed to mainstream conceptions of beauty that stress a thinner, whiter, ultra young look. I am a brown woman myself in my 20s with big brown eyes, long dark thick hair, dark thick eyebrows, ambiguous ethnic features, petite and somewhat thick. I don't care if you're over a decade older than me. I don't care if you're bigger than thick. Fat-shaming is reprehensible. And I also don't care if you're smaller than thick. Just be body positive. (Although I myself have self-esteem issues/body-image issues I struggle with inspite of my body positive philosophical beliefs, and it is okay if you're dealing with the same issues. We could uplift eachother.)

Personality wise, I like a very self-confident, assertive, dominant personality. Though I have my own variety of strength, I do like being submissive. I like someone who leads with a compassionate, considerate foot though and who doesn't dominate in a controlling, arrogant way. I like an empathetic, uplifting woman who is happily willing to provide me with reassurances when I feel down and want to vent. (I would reciprocate of course.) I like someone who is outspoken and who can handle my rapidfire questioning. I like a woman with a weird, mad streak and aesthetic who likes non-sequiturs and stream-of-consciousness banter. And I look forward to meeting a woman who will take me on adventures, late night adventures in her car or through BART or the bus or on bikes where we explore, grab some hot tea, and just pick eachother's minds for hours until we find some kind of catharsis.

I am currently going through a depression and existential crisis of sorts and so I would hope to find support in you and would also be happy to provide support in return. I have been trying to empower myself by exercising, listening to upbeat music and trying to avoid my habit of sulking with melancholy tracks, keeping my place clean, focusing on my academic and future professional ambitions, and actively trying not to dwell on negative things. I think expanding my network and finding a supportive, intelligent, like-minded woman would help tremendously. Hopefully I could be of help to you.

I look forward to hearing from you. Let me know your age, profession, professional aspirations/ambitions, your schooling (former, present or future), what your personality is like, your location, your hobbies, etc. Perhaps if we could have some promising letter exchanges, texts and phone calls, we could meet for a dinner and movie. 

Though I will likely be warm, candid, and flirtacious during our prior talks and meeting, I am not going to get idealistically overly invested in you from the get-go, and you ought to be similarly reluctant and cautious. I just want to live in the moment and enjoy your company while I have it and not worry about whether our connection will endure and get better, even if those worries will likely accumulate in the back of my mind anyway. I don't want to have loaded expectations and burden you with them. Let's not think about it too much and just have fun and perhaps help eachother cope along the way if we see it fit. If we don't click well, so be it. We can still wish eachother the best.

title: Just searching
text:
Might as well state off the bat, to weed out unnecessary responses ha: i know this is a women seeking women ad, but no I don't want to be your curiosity satisfying, experimental lesbian fling. so if that's what you want you should probably look elsewhere. kay, great, now that's out of the way...

hmm. never really know where to start with these.. name maybe? yeah name is good. my name is Sarah. :P kinda hard to summarize yourself, but I'll start with a few fun facts- I'm thoughtful, good-natured, bit of a goofball, i love conversing about pretty much anything from lighthearted to in depth so long as the dialogue flows, though awkward conversations can be fun and memorable as well. i'm a nature loving, ocean diving, animal loving flower child, i enjoy a variety of music, so if you want a conversation starter feel free to ask about that- or be brave and tell me what you like first. :) i have a broad variety of activities i like, including but not limited to- hiking, swimming, daydreaming, reading, doodling, etcetera. i can be a pretty balanced blend of active and couch potato, which side comes out usually depends on who i'm hanging with. anyways, i'm on here cause work is a bit of a time consumer, i'd like to have someone to share new experiences with, plus it'd be great to meet more folks who fall under the lgbtq umbrella, though its cool to meet straight peeps as well, so long as you're respectful. additionally, i'm open to not just friends but potentially a fwb's, or possibly a romantic partner, depending. So if you feel we could potentially hit it off in either of these departments, don't be shy to message. i'm pretty approachable, yunno, like i said, so long as you're respectful and all that jazz. aka just don't be a jerk and we'll be cool. x)

when it comes to romantic/sexual interests, i'm looking for females ONLY, i can't stress that enough, but i feel like i have to press this, based on the opposite sex trying to hit me up for dates and/or hookups. guys, this is a woman seeks woman ad, c'mon now. moving on, where romantic interests are concerned, i'd like to talk to someone who is passionate about something, has some self confidence, someone who has a decent sense of humor, knows how to be respectful, is naturally an affectionate soul, and likes to go on adventures. someone who is very comfortable with who they are. Looks wise I am not incredibly particular, I like an array of body types but mainly my attention is captivated by engaging personality and a cute face. :) I am on the thicker/curvier side so whoever is interested from a dating standpoint needs to be ok with that. 

friends: can be of any sex: anyone who can appreciate a sarcastic sense of humor and can give it back, in a fun and playful way, not a snide way. someone who is supportive, real, laid back but also likes to go on adventures, as well. 

deal breakers for me when it comes to romantic interests: cigarette smokers, taking hard drugs, bad hygiene, lack of imagination and compassion- personality wise. also please be STD free if you are interested and want to contact me for potential romance purposes. putting it out there cause better safe than sorry. 

other deal-breakers, for FRIENDS, OR ROMANTIC INTERESTS: having a sexist, violent, racist, or really, derogatory in any way, type of mindset. just. nope. tryina steer clear of negativity here, folks! 

&,

if you are interested in seeing if a friendship or more can be sparked here, please send me a photo of you (keep it pg please,) along with the headline of "FRIEND" if you are interested in friendship, and "SOMETHING MORE" if you think we could have some chemistry, so I know you are real and I know what you are seeking. also i will be more eager to respond if you do this, cause it'll show you read my information and are actually interested in details. heads up, if you don't send me a picture i'll be less inclined to respond if we're being honest.

additionally, please only message me if you are in or near Milpitas/San Jose or can make the trip here, ideally though I'd like to establish good connections with peeps (friends or otherwise,) that are in my area. to clarify, if you are interested in more than friendship, the age range I'm willing to date is 20-30... in some cases, 35 at the oldest. Please take that into account.

another thing to take into account when messaging, make it a message that's worth replying to! I've had some thoughtful responses, but i've gotten my fair share of hi's and hey's, one worded responses don't do much for me. :P 

thanks guys, let's make something happen here. :) 

peace and well wishes. 



p.s. Dudes, if you send me a dick pic I will just laugh and proceed to delete it. Really, not trying to be harsh, but sending one to begin with is awkward, and you would get nothing positive out of it. again just to to reiterate, i'm open to a friendship with you if you are male however I'm only interested in dating women. 

p.s.s. I would like to disclose (since this has caused some confusion and conflict, though i don't know why) I identify as pansexual, feel free to look up the definition and ask me about it if you are confused, however if you are disrespectful about it we aren't going to get along. i am attracted to various genders and personalities, but at this point in time, i'm ONLY interested in women romantically. girls, if you are interested in me, great, but don't try to get me to change my orientation, or look down upon it, guys, don't look at it as an opportunity to try to get in my pants cause it's not happening. aaaand yeah, that long side note about covers it. haha. 

do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers

title: Fun, Solid, Expansive, & Satisfying?
text:
...stuck somewhere between the subject titles "Aquarius Seeks Birthday Spanking" and "Ripe for longterm potential." They need not be mutually exclusive. Better to simplify.

So I don't waste anyone's time: you need to be a woman in her thirties or early forties, healthy, emotionally available, and willing to make time to hang out regularly if we connect (at least while we're feeling out our potential--otherwise, let's move on). 

You're probably not at extreme ends of the spectrum, but who knows? I've had my mind changed before. Here are the topics upon which my mind will not change: 

I.

Hikes on forested hills, organic cooking, grounded spirituality, the inner and the interpersonal, global consciousness, multicultural science fiction & fantasy, deep ecology, dance, equity, diversity, advocacy, positive social change, life-long learning.

II.

Sexuality, sensuality, healthy verbal and nonverbal communication. Pleasure, creativity, connection, fun. Better if you're 50-95 % dominant (yes, a wide range). Hot--to and for me--but that could look many different ways. Be currently unattached, though: I prefer monogamy. 

III.

The deep capacity to love and to receive love. It's so often stated, so challenging to verify via cyberspace, and so completely essential. (Please note that I have an affinity for the Oxford comma. I can live with differences, but attempted conversions will drive me away.)

IV.

The capacity to be independent and the desire to be interdependent. Building partnership, family, community. Setting healthy boundaries is a good skill, but so's showing up for family members and friends when they really need it. Even if it's inconvenient. Even if it requires sacrifice. I have that in me, and I like to be close to people who have that in them as well. Anything less will not work. (This is not an ultimatum; I just know that there are some things that are entirely cultural/temperamental and cannot be learned.)

V.

A willingness to be reflective, working with personal challenges and relationship challenges. When people grow close, there are always challenges; hopefully, they will be minimal and workable, but it's more important to me to be with someone who's capable of honestly looking at herself and at me and consciously working through conflicts than someone who'll always agree with me. Compassion and humor trump rightness. 

VI.

You don't believe in punishment--except in consensual adult play, which might be fun to explore (but no "lifestyle" obessionists, please--it's boring to be boxed in, there's more to life than sexual roles).

I'm ready. Are you ready? I think I'm ready. Do you think you're ready? 

Excitement trumps anxiety.

title: Looking for something specific
text:
Wanted: Good looking, mature, intelligent, open-minded, local.

So here's the deal:

I am in a long distance relationship, have been for 2 years now, and it's going to continue.
But it's an open relationship, so I can date others if I chose to.
And I chose to, if I can find what I am looking for.
This understanding is where the "open-minded" requirement comes in.
This is not about just sex - you don't see this posted in the casual encounters section, or see me asking for a fwb, do you?
No.
This is about having someone to spend time with, go out with, talk to.
Dinner, concerts, movies, or just sit at the bar and have a couple of beers.
If the chemistry and the compatibility lead to sex, then that's fine, but it's not the reason I'm here.
That's where the "mature" requirement come in.
It also helps if you have a job and a car.
And please be in Sonoma County at least.
I am already in a long distance relationship and don't want another.
I want someone here, in real flesh, for actual human contact.
That's where the "local" requirement comes in.
Age and ethnicity are not an issue, as compatibility knows no bounds.
Also, if you identify as FtM, MtF, or "fluid" or similar, I am open to that as well.
And here's where I admit to being shallow: looks do matter, at least to me.
I apologize in advance for that, but it goes to the heart of attraction.
We are all attracted to someone "good looking".
I am 50, and I am told often that I am beautiful (sometimes cute too).
Obviously, I'll let you decide that for yourself.
And if you don't think I am, and you are not attracted to me, I understand.
It's natural and normal.
And finally, please be open enough, and patient enough, to want to spend at least a couple of e-mails sharing information and getting know a little about each other first.
Since this is not an ad for a "casual encounter", don't expect me to want to "come over" and "chill" before I even know anything about you.
Sure, some people can do that, but that's not me.
Ok, sound picky? Sound demanding?
Yes, it is.
I am a strong independent woman who knows what she wants and won't accept less.
If you can't handle that, just move on to the next ad.
No big deal. We all have our requirements.
And I wouldn't expect you, or anyone else, to settle for less than you want or deserve.
Thanks for your time.
Happy Superbowl !!

title: Christian ISO Christian
text: DWF, 52, Christian is seeking only marriage minded completely unattached and single Christian man. Marriage agrees with me and not desperate to remarry but casual dating has never been my thing. As a Christian it's important that we be equally yoked and this can take a bit when discerning God's choice for us. I'm a generally happy person and am happy in my career path. I don't have any children and if you have adult, independent ones that's fine but young or older dependents probably would not be a good match. We all carry baggage, that's inevitable, but please have yours under control and let the dramas of the past stay there. I've elected to not date these past few years until I was ready to open my heart in order to fully love another, with no reservations, and the time is now. I'm independent and have strong core values, such as honesty, integrity, loyalty, faithfulness, charity and love. I love adventure, traveling by car and by plane, exploring out of the way places and gaining value and knowledge by meeting interesting people and just learning in general. I'm a great traveling companion and will chit chat happily, sing to music and whatever seems like fun at the moment! Will keep you on your toes for sure and you will enjoy the ride! Vitals: I'm a BBW, 5'7", freckled, be-speckled, formal education (college degrees), love learning in general, love documentaries, reading anything I can find; love doing arts and crafts; writing letters the old fashioned way; am generally old fashioned when it comes to values. I've lived long enough where I'm not impressed by what you can give me but who you are. At the same time I manage my own finances so please be fiscally responsible, have your own car and place. Please be between 35 and 60, have similar values and characteristics I've described above, at least 5'6" and not be African American, nothing against that just not my personal preference is all. An advanced degree would be helpful so we'd have a similar education in common but if you are bright and love learning in general, that works too. I naturally talk using "big words" as my friends say and it's not to impress or make you feel inferior, I've been doing it since age 17, it's just the way I communicate and I'm confident in asking questions and saying "I don't know" and am secure in my past relationships so if you have a tendency for jealousy or possessiveness, guarantee I'm not your lady. The only games I enjoy playing are board games, not mind games. That's not my style and believing in speaking the truth in love. Serious responses only. Your photo gets mine. Please say more than just "Hi" and leave your telephone number. Cutting and pasting responses is pretty obvious and will not likely respond to any of the above. I know my value and if what I wrote inspires a reply, please show you mean it by putting effort into it. Serious, considered replies will receive a response. I promise!

title: A simple post
text:
It really should be simple, right? A woman seeks a man. Woman provides a brief description of who she is and what captivates her. Man responds. They correspond briefly, talk on the phone and make a plan to meet. I never presume chemistry; this can only be determined face-to-face.

That's really all I seek, an opportunity to meet someone in person to determine compatibility. This forum is just a starting point. I realize that I do not know my entire audience on CL and that I might be casting my net to those who are not my type (married/partnered, out for just sex, tobacco smokers, and unhealthy lifestyles). However, I am hopeful that there might be one or two out here that are like me - sane, stable (financially and emotionally), good career, give a damn about others and the world, and happy. 

Me:
SWF
Advanced degree
Successful career that I actually enjoy
Healthy/Exercise daily
Bikram yoga lover
Farmers Market enthusiast 
Follow whole food plant based diet
Avid reader 
NPR listener
Animal lover 
Bernie supporter
Active listener


You:
Good communicator
Grounded
Have goals/ambition 
Active lifestyle
Emotionally available 

I really do not have a huge laundry list of required qualities. It would be great if we had some shared interests and if you live in SF.

Traveling, culture and meeting nice people inspires me. I'm outgoing and friendly in nature and enjoy intelligent conversation with people from all walks of life. I'm non judgmental and generous at heart.
I seek a confident man who has refined his references in life, yet is open minded and adventurous...maybe even a little spontaneous! Yes, I have been known to travel at the drop of a suitcase. Decisions in general are easy when values are clear. I trust my instincts and know myself

It's these expressions I never give
That keep me searching for a heart of gold,
And I'm getting old.

Neil Young's words capture how I feel about finding a man who -- like me -- has a heart of gold.

If you're the one I seek, you're a kind, compassionate, caring gentleman between the ages of 60 and 75 who lives close enough to me so we can play together frequently. Physically, I am of average height and weight (5'4"/~138 lbs.), and considered pretty/attractive...but attraction is personal. title: Press pause
text:
Internet dating creates the perception of abundant supply. No matter how many people we meet, we feel there are still lots out there. The supply erodes the value of any one individual. As a result people pass over great relationship opportunities on the hunt for the ever-more-perfect one. We skim the surface, rather than diving deep into the the experience of dating. When you find that person that makes you happy, be grateful and stay with them. Know when you have won the race

I am:

Tall (over 6') 
Curvy, buxom, athletic
Fit (do some sort of exercise daily)
Baseball and Buddhism are my religion 
Love all sports (especially hockey and baseball) 
Love to cook 
Into punk rock music, but will listen to all kinds 
Active (walk/cycle every where, do yoga, etc.) 
Commuter (no car, cycle over 50+ miles a week)
Spontaneous 
Childlike and playful 
Openminded 
Confident 
Intelligent 
Love animals 
Progressive (tattoo's and piercings) 
Romantic (It's all about the chase) 
Sensual 
Spiritual (practicing Buddhist) 
Philanthropist (I volunteer regularly for LGBT organizations, and HIV/AIDS fundraisers)

You are: 
Single, available to meet someone, did I mention single? 
Non-smoker 
Great sense of humor 
Intelligent 
Employed 
Evolved 
Have a spiritual path 
Open to being intimate 
Compassionate 
Have a sense of adventure 
Be able to carry on a conversation 
Tolerant 
Curious 
Passionate 
Local (this has been known to be a deal breaker)
Tall (would be nice since I am an amazon)

I would love to have someone in my life that can text me with some little snippet and make me laugh, some witty little observation about something he's seen or done, someone that when I mention there is a meteor shower that night says I am on my way over, let's head up Page Mill and check it out. Someone that acts like a total fool in public because he's comfortable enough in his own skin that he doesn't care what others may think. Would be nice to have someone that I wake up thinking about, even when he's right there next to me

*The fine print* Have a great sense of humor, be intelligent, have a job, a means of transportation, don't smoke, be evolved, look for substance in someone, open to being intimate, compassionate, a sense of adventure, maybe a childlike sense of wonder of how cool and amazing things can be in this amazing place we live, be able to carry on a conversation 

Be the person that you want to meet...are you that super cool, funny, intelligent, fit guyer that I want to meet up with?

title: Seeking a new best friend / partner / companion / lover
text:

Neither of us is currently partnered, and we crave the steadfast companionship and deep intimacy we have experienced and expressed in past monogamous relationships. Living long has made us far wiser than we were in our youth. We acknowledge our imperfections and recognize that understanding, compassion, affection, and acceptance are essential to a lasting relationship.

We are both intelligent, articulate people, active and involved, socially and politically liberal, and financially stable. We're still healthy, energetic, and attractive, and we intend to keep ourselves that way for many years to come.

Here are some specifics about me:

I am HWP (5'4" tall, ~137 lbs.) and Caucasian. Raised east-coast Jewish, for the past two decades I have been an active member of a progressive religious community that includes people of all persuasions. I am omnivorous, and get along best with those similarly inclined. Semi-retired now, I continue to seek ways to contribute my experience and energy to people and projects that make a difference in the world. Among the pastimes I enjoy are music and dancing, puzzles, cooking and savoring good food and beverage, hiking and exploring (especially with my canine companion), flowers and plants, computers and the Internet, movies and some TV, home maintenance and renovation. My social and political leanings are decidedly liberal/progressive.

If you resonate with this post, I hope you'll write to tell me about yourself (age and location are essential!), what you're looking for, why you're responding. When you do, please attach a current photo; I will happily reciprocate if we seem to be a match.

title: Smart/Goofy/Adventurous SWF looking for LTR
text:
Hi There - What's a nice guy like you doing in a place like this? I know what I am doing here and if you would like to know, keep reading...



I am a 33 year old Jewish single white female who has lived in the Bay Area for 14 years. I moved here from Los Angeles for college and decided to stick around. I worked in ecommerce for a long time and currently work in international trade. I am a pretty silly/goofy lady and appreciate someone who has a great sense of humor and can be witty (wordplay and puns are especially exciting to me). I would get along with someone who can appreciate an episode of Curb Your Enthusiasm, and enjoys sending random memes or gifs to me throughout the day (I would respond accordingly).



I am quick-witted and intelligent myself and appreciate someone who can hold a good intellectual conversation. It doesn't mean we have to stay up all night talking about Descartes or Hegel, but it would be awesome if you knew who those people were. I mean if we can't think, do we even exist?



I am a huge traveller and have completed a year of solo travel. Places I especially love are Myanmar, Indonesia, Vietnam, Argentina, Peru, Italy, Germany and others. I can't wait to see more of the world!



I also am a big supporter of the arts, especially local visual artists and jewelry makers. I enjoy going to art walks and flea markets (old stuff was made really well).



I am a pretty independent person with my own friends, hobbies and life and am looking for someone who comes with their own friends, hobbies and life as well.



I am a spiritual person, but not Bay Area weird/woo woo spiritual. I have had enough experiences to illustrate to me that certain things happen for a reason and that sometimes there might be a bigger picture.



Babies/Kids and old people bring me lots of joy. I intend to have them (kids) and become one (an old person). I am very empathetic and get along well with them. I have a unique gift that allows me to find a way to connect with almost everyone I meet. This allowed me to travel around the world successfully alone for a prolonged period of time.



So that is me (with a bit of what I am looking for). I would love to find a kind gentleman (for some reason this word reminds me of Mr. Peanut - I think it's the hat and monocle- though those are not a necessity for me :)) who has a sense of humor, adventure (roadtrips and big trips), and a love for learning. 



I am also looking for a partner who would love to take walks/hikes and cook together to create a mutual healthy lifestyle. 



This person should be gainfully employed and want to have kids and be in a rad partnership.



In terms of looks, I am gorgeous (have been told this by many people - not just my mom :)) with brown hair and green eyes. I am 5 foot 6 inches and zaftig but strong and athletic (have previously competed in triathlons).



If the above sounds good - I would love to hear from you. Please tell me about yourself, send me a pic and include your favorite meme/gif/youtube clip. Also - I am not ageist, so if you are younger/older and think we might be a great fit- reach out!



Hope to hear from you :)

title: Taking a chance....
text:
Know this is a long shot, but figured I'd give this a try before I pay for a "real" online dating site; so here goes my attempt at finding a needle in a haystack:-)
About me:
I'm a 37 yo swf, who is 5'5 and a size 16 with light brown hair and blue eyes. I'm pretty lucky- my life is pretty great; I've got great friends, wonderful family, a career that I love, etc etc but lately (more so than usual) I've been missing someone special to share it with.i want to find someone that I can enjoy spending my free time with, laugh a lot and get to know on a deep level. I'm one of the sweetest, loyal most affectionate people you'll ever meet. I'm always up for an adventure and will try almost anything once. Surprisingly I tend to like traditional gender roles although I could also be called somewhat of a feminist.I love helping others- especially those in need. Things haven't always come easy for me so I never take life, or the people in it for granted.
Who I'm looking for:
I'm looking for a man who is pretty much in the same situation as I am. Life is good but it could be better with someone to share it with. Someone who is passionate- about SOMETHING. I'd like to meet someone who has no problem getting to know a woman on a deeper level to explore whether a relationship may be possible. Men who know what they want, aren't afraid to express it and have a great sense of humor to the front of the line!!!
Just in case you didn't get it by now- I'm looking for a relationship. I'm not in a hurry to get into one but would like to start exploring that as soon as possible with someone I enjoy spending time with and TALKING to. I am NOT looking for a chat buddy, to exchange endless emails OR a hook up. Please don't waste my time or yours (my friends have given me fair waiting about this lol)
If you're still reading and are interested, or at least intrigued email me- you never know what could happen! In your email please let me know a little about yourself including age and city that you live in, why you chose to respond and what you are passionate about. One liners will be deleted.
Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

title: Any Academics/Writers?
text:
I am interested in meeting an academic in every obnoxiously erudite loaded sense of the word, though without the enormous ego that usually comes with it. But I am also flexible about what I mean by an academic as I am aware that there are many talented autodidacts who bypassed a formal education and who found formal education disillusioning and could not continue finding that it stunted their creativity or spirit. I can empathize with both the somewhat bitter and regretful yet zealously commited academic and just as well with the drop-out. So I am not such an elitist that I am only looking for someone who has climbed into the upper echelons of academia, but I am looking for someone who has wide academic/intellectual interests and pursuits. 

I am looking for someone who has had significant writing/teaching experience or related aspirations which they're preferably already on the path to bringing to fruition if they haven't arrived already. I like many different kinds of prose from longwinded Rushie and Faulkner to the terse Vonnegut. I am very pleasantly encumbered by dense paragraphs of detail upon detail, so long as the content is interesting. I am personally interested in pursuing writing in journalism (travel, wartime, editorials on topics like race, gender and other stigmas etc,) revisionist historical writing, and film as well as literary criticism.

What I am looking for in a personality is someone who can present a lot of self-confidence, even if it is in part a well cultivated facade. I like a resilient, calm, mature personality who can brave a storm either quietly or like a tormented artist take to writing about his pain, distilling his wounds in poignant, yet controlled prose. I especially like a rather dominant, assertive personality, someone in the habit of guiding and instructing though in a gentle, non-controlling way. I favor a very empathetic person who can listen well, someone who can inspire introspection and provide insightful feedback that reflects dutiful psycho-analysis. I like an uplifting, reassuring, consoling personality as I have been melancholy and down on myself and want to spend my time with people who help me get away from if not channel those painful propensities.

Finally, I am also fond of an offbeat, eccentric, somewhat-mad streak in a person that manifests in stream of consciousness banter, caustic wit and jarring non-sequiturs.

If we end up enjoying one another's minds after exchanging some thoughtful letters, phone calls and texts, my ideal meeting might include eating out and talking, walking around and talking, possibly watching a movie. I like someone who knows his way around a city, knows good food, good restaurants, good movies, knows public transit and who can lead the way for adventure. Eventually I would want to watch movies at your place and attempt to cook better than merely edible food together. We could also sit and listen to music and talk with a hot cup of somewhat spiced rich tea, and if that sounds too cloyingly precious and pretentious, we could have staring contests and ridicule eachother until the other smiles.

Maybe an enduring friendship will come out of these interactions or maybe only one or two decent meetings accompanied by indifferent or hurt feelings. I do not want to think far ahead nor invest myself idealistically, and neither should you. I just want to live in the moment as vexingly trite as that sounds and enjoy some meaningful company while it's there.

So tell me your age, profession, aspirations, personality description, what your day to day life is like, what you have studied and study now be it formally or otherwise, what your hobbies are, what kind of food you like etc.

I myself am in my twenties, a student, not yet a professional, currently in an existential crisis but managing. I am not gorgeous, neither thin nor huge. I do not care if you're older so long as you're not a creepy seedy opportunist on the prowl for young women who write long irritating sentences, (assuming some men fetishize wordy prose and youth...)

title: Come hither!!!
text:
Oh my god!

It seems to me,from what I see on CL,that all the unattached men are either dead or afraid of God-knows-what. The few that are available only want to date multiple women while all the married men are looking to get some underground girlfriend.

Is it possible,by some slim stroke of luck, that there's someone out there who wants to have a relationship with THE one woman because he's tired of coming home to an empty bed at night? Who longs to have his own friend/confidante that he can count on to be there when he needs to talk at midnight and will take his calls no matter how late because that's what partners do? Who's out with his friends and suddenly smiles to himself because he knows that he's got someone who cares about him ,for sure? 

I'm just exhausted with loneliness...LOL! I know,it makes no sense. I'm hoping there's someone out there who's lonely too. Please,be healthy and happy and NOT looking for a wife. 

*Sigh*

Not particularly holding my breath but I thought it was worth a shot,no?

title: I think I love you
text:
I refused to believe that it could be so,
There's no way that I'm in love with you,
I lied to myself that it's just a petty jealousy,
That I must be feeling lonely, but I cannot hide it anymore.

I think I love you
But it must be so, cause I miss you
Without you,
I cannot do anything,
And you are always on my mind,
So seeing this, it must be,
I was unaware,
But now I can see that
Your presence have delved deeply into my heart.

We are not meant for each other, and being friends is the best thing for us,
There isn't a single thing we have in common,
So I claimed there's no way we can be lovers,
But I don't want to make excuses anymore.

title: Got Game? Got Integrity? Got both?
text:
While the urban dictionary defines this as a 'dude with a lot of chicks,' I think this erroneous.

A guy with game has sophistication, allure, charm, wit, smarts, and confidence. Think 1940's protagonists. Yum.

Integrity? Using said game to connect, be present and relate to the woman in front of you...
riffing each moment, enjoying her feminine charms, independence, and her millions sparks of being. Allowing yourself to be charmed and entranced by the magic created by just being who you are, and who she is, in those moments.


Now take all that, and add to that the skills learned in a life well lived, and having gained the insight into self, the celebration of what comes when two people really groove and show up, and the props to actually co-create a life together worth living, which includes communication and respect...

Bliss unfolding.

You out there? Available? Just me waiting, still.
Ping me.

And send requisite words and image.

title: Looking for a woman who needs help & guidance in her life

title: A Much Nicer Climate For One Special Lady
text:
Only you know why you are wondering around the nooks and crannies of CL but if you are the right lady I have an idea for you.

It does not matter if this post is a week or six months old. I am running it in multiple US cities and I am renewing the post every 2 days until the right lady comes along. When she does I'll pull this post but until then, the offer is open.

I am looking for a lady on disability or SS or supports themselves by working from home over the net.
She has to be at least 37 years old but under 66 years old and still active enough to enjoy swimming and day trips. I might consider someone younger then 37 depending on her personality.
I'll Repeat Myself, You Must Be On Disability Or Social Security Or Have An Independent Income.
If that is you keep reading you might like this idea.
You can be White, Oriental, Vietnamese, Asian, Spanish, Chinese, Puerto Rican or Native American.

What I have in mind is to live together on a tropical island and be unique but happy couple.

I know, you're sure that your $700.00 a month makes it impossible to live in the tropics. Normally you would be right, but not this time. 

I am an older white male that has literally retired to a tropical island in the Caribbean. 
In fact I am just over 1,000 miles South of Key West. 
Bermuda, The Bahamas, Cuba, Jamaica, Haiti and the Dominican Republic are all North of Me.
I have the apartment, I have the car, I get a pension check.
I am proposing you join me here. 

If you are sick of cold and wet drop me a note.
If you are raising a child or grand child, that is not an issue. I like children and we have some 
good schools here. A brand new Elementary opened up last month and it is only a couple 
minutes away by car.

Most of the replies I get that were actually generated by a human ask about the need for a Passport. This is still part of the U.S. If you are born here you are a US Citizen. You do not need a passport to move here. I do suggest you get one because there are day trips available to a different country. Out in the morning, spend a day in the DR or British Virgins and back that afternoon.

I have gotten some replies that say they would like to move here but they have been in prison.
That Is NOT a problem. If you are not on parole or probation you can move here any time you want.

Of course there are things I am not putting in this post. 
Long posts do not get read. We will talk it all over in e-mail's.

All the pictures are less then 10 Min from my door.

The Caribbean never drops below 80 degrees. Most of the time it is between 81 and 84 degrees.
The temperature never goes below 70 degrees.

Liqueur sales is 24 / 7 and all grocery stores have a basic selection. 
If it is late most Walgreen's are open 24 /7

Gambling is legal here.
I have 2 nice casinos just a few min away.

The drugs, crime, prostitutes and gangs are all in San Juan.
San Juan is 3 hours away.
There is no mass transit or public transportation so the gangs and drugs stay in San Juan.

NO AFRICAN
NO MALES
NO HOMOSEXUALS
NO SEXUAL FREAKS KNOWN AS TG
NO PRIVATE E-MAIL
NO PHONE NUMBERS
NO PICTURES
NO LINKS
IF YOU DO NOT USE WHOLE WORDS DON'T REPLY
IF YOU LIVE BY TEXT DO NOT REPLY
IF YOU CAN NOT WRITE AT LEAST ONE PARAGRAPH DO NOT REPLY

IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE MINIMUM CRITERIA DO NOT BOTHER ME

Please change the subject so it says, "beaches"
