title: Sweet Dreams & Road Trips
text:
I acknowledge that this post is quite long but if you don't have the patience to read the whole thing then you are missing out.If you get it and are intrigued,please send me an email.All I ask is that you are not shallow and careless.I'm not "ugly " in fact really it's only a word,but I've heard I'm quite decent looking and im not demented but I think it's unattractive to wear a black heart.If you have a pic,please send it,this is only for my own curiosity and protection against spammers (the bad kind) and porno ads because none of those are acceptable for an intimate relationship.Friends are welcome too and if you can't tell I like writing.I love communicating,befriending with all kinds of people.
I try to focus on the road ahead and occasionally catch gripes of your silhouette in the sun to my right,I stare at my hands and my eyes wonder,beginning at your bare feet on the dashboard,trailing up to your knees up your sexy thigh and each and every thread on the sweater laying across your stomach which is breathing with every laugh or yawn.I listen to you talk for hours and input philosophical debate.I smile at your simple ways speechlessly,even the way you eat,the way your eyes light up when you're flirting back,the way you laugh at nothing.The sun outlines those lines and shadows in just the right way leaving a halo around your soul,irradiating pure grace.
"Focus" I tell myself and my eyes flick back to the traffic ten gaping cars pass ahead,I flicker back to the valley between your beautiful breasts and to the road again,to your collarbone,to the yellow lines and brake lights ahead,to the clock on the radio and back to your neck line.You're sleeping now and we've been driving for hours.In your stillness,in the long silence,your essence swirls in the sun as if you are lively even though you are asleep.The breeze from the window distracts me as it delivers perfect little amounts of your sweet smelling skin across my nose,the way your hair smells haunts me and I just want to pull you in close so I can breath you in.A smile broaders across my face,a sweet,sweet smile of content as my eyes flick to the outlines of your beautiful face and how peaceful it rests there,trusting me completely and comfortably enough to fall asleep while I drive.My mind flashes back to the rest stop hours before and my body begins to burn as I remember the pit stop in the rain.The Windows fogged and we put the seats back and began drawing pictures on the Windows and without wearing you were on top of me in the drivers seat.
I dart back to my hands and find myself staring at them in disgust while my peripheral vision watches the road.I turn one over and examine one at a time.I peruse my knuckles,I peek at my eyes in the rear view and again I trail up your legs,your stomach,your neck,your chin,your nose and your eyes in a golden glow,I'm in awe as I gaze at you in silence,the sun streaming through the clouds and piercing my sight.I carefully grab my sunglasses with a smile and put them on to see better and laugh to myself as if you're so brilliantly bright I need them to look at you.I think of my hands dancing on your skin,gripping and tugging,pulling and rubbing,scratching and satisfying you until you shook in the cold winter air.The rain creating a beat on the roof,your hand prints on my skin and window.I shake my head and grip the wheel,These hands,these depressed hard workers shouldn't be allowed to touch something as illuminating and golden as your skin,never mind to taste your bittersweet sweat,As I drove south and out of the cold,The warmth and release that you are "The One" encompass me.
Sometimes I forget to see myself through your eyes and I'm humbled in this moment when you wake up.Your eyes trail my body from my knees,up my stomach,along my collarbone,up my neck,behind my ear and along my chin,lips,nose and eyes,you lean forward and kiss me on the check,then right below my ear with a goggle,whispering passed my senses sweet nothings of once upon a dream as you steal my sun glasses.You turn your hands over and shake your head in silence with a grin and say I LOVE YOU.
I'm not desperate,in fact I'm not hallucinating I just enjoy writing to you vividly.Imagination is a powerful thing,you see,this was a dream I had once.I'm not interested in the adjectives of life or who you were or what labels you categorize yourself in,I'm interested in the living,breathing verb of who you are.I've been waiting patiently for a while for days like these since I had this dream and I can't get the ideal of you out of my head...I'm tired of just sex.That's easy enough to get,I want someone to captivate my mine,challenge my opinion,lick my intelligence,stimulate my adrenaline and lay in bed all day laughing.Someone to kiss under the mistletoe on New Year's Day,Someone who my whole family talks about in a whisper and says"Oh I just love her,She's so warm,what a beautiful girl" just because they're watching you play Simon says with my little cousins making them laugh,Someone to tuck my hands under their bra when they're cod and we're watching the ocean in autumn,Someone to paint tempered chocolate on some random Sunday afternoon,Someone to go skinny dipping with at midnight and hiking at 7 am or make hundreds of snow angles and sliding on a piece of cardboard down a hill,Someone to have crazy sex with because they picked out the cute-est bra.I want a name to doodle while at work and a text to look forward to.I want someone who I don't think I can find.I know you are out there somewhere sleeping,listening to music and watching the sun come up or God knows what else you might be doing at 2am.
Are you reading this ad yet,maybe I've met you in someway already and I just don't have a clue.I have a feeling I would know right away ;))
It might take months or years until we bump into each other some where in just the right way or someone sends me an e-mail and actually wants to meet up for coffee ?? It might be tomorrow or maybe just maybe it might be saved for last as most things best are.I'm willing to wait.I like writing to you ahead of time,I enjoy it.I feel as if perhaps someday years after we do collide.I'll be able to truly say "See I was really waiting and thinking of you"I love corny affect :)
I guess what I've learned which,truthfull,I'm never quite done learning is that real love can not be found nor fabricated or settled for,but grown and a pleasant surprise I'm waiting for the day when I see you and that glow circles you as I was babbling about.I want someone to be my passenger on life's crazy adventures,but I don't need someone to live.I could function without you,I could breath,I could sleep around,I could ignore that empty passenger seat but the key is I don't want to.There's a fine line between need and want l'd rather want to share my life with someone than need to.

title: Older Male looking to pamper young lady
text:
Hello, my ad reader. I am looking for a young woman who would just barely consider answering this ad, but yet whom is still just adventurous enough to consider the possibilities to read on, and maybe take the next exploratory step. You probably will, but please, please, by all means, stop reading this ad the moment you lose sufficient curiosity.

This young woman would be honest, open, 18-24, thin, petite, or athletic, not extremely tatted or alternatively pierced, on the girly-girl side of the spectrum, non-smoking, STD free, fairly clean-cut (but with an "edge speed" that can be taken out of hiding), open-minded, free from a lot of attitude, and WITHOUT a taste for drama. 

She would be willing every couple of weeks to keep a little company. Being mobile would be a definite advantage.

This would be with a male who is single, extremely clean, fit, safe, cleaner-cut (this ad was purposely NOT put in Casual Encounters Section) non-weird, successful, flexible, realistic, non-possessive, non-jealous, and giving. 

Everything would always be kept TOTALLY PRIVATE and DISCREET, and the young woman would be absolutely free to live her life completely as she chose -- apart from those occasional visits, and the modest/moderate tangible gifts she would reliably receive as a rewarding (with some of the things that she had made known that she liked or needed most), and this in appreciation and thankfulness for what she AGREED to give. 

After the "occasional visit" was scheduled (around both of the involved parties' lives), it would always "all go back in the covered box again") -- until the scheduling of the next possible meeting. The young woman could always continue to explore, or continue the started arrangement, as far as it worked sufficiently for her. 

IF YOU FIT THE DESCRIPTION FAIRLY CLOSELY (of what the ad writer has written that he is most looking for), AND followed the written guidelines for responding coming in the next paragraph, the ad writer will welcome your email, and reminds you that, Just because you look, that doesn't mean you are in any way obligated to test drive. 

The ad writer will ONLY respond to EMAILS that include: (1) (THREE) fairly clear, accurate, and recent FACE and BODY pics of YOU, and that (2) contain your accurate AGE, and CITY of RESIDENCE, and (3) Have in the EMAIL SUBJECT HEADER YOUR FAVORITE RESTAURANT, (and optionally, more information about you, what you might be looking for, or open to -- or not, and or pressing questions you might have).

ALL EMAILS NOT FULLY COMPLYING TO THE ABOVE PARAGRAPH WILL BE DELETED. The ad writer will NOT respond first to another email address other than the CL one, or go to any WEBSITE. Save your fingers.

The ad writer is honest, direct, and a straight shooter; that's what he wants in return, even if either party is not interested at any point in continuing the exploration. If the ad writer returns your email, his face pics and more information will definitely be included in the next step of exploration.

title: Women hate black men (very long ad)
text:
I am really getting tired of people always hating us black men like we did something personally to them, and I don't think it's fair that we are the only race who constantly gets judged because somebody else of the same race did something to somebody. Why can't people look at us as individuals instead of a group because that is how we see other people well at least I do. If I would blame everybody for what their race has done then I would blame white people for slavery and many other things but I don't. I don't understand why women think that saying that they aren't interested in black men isn't racist when that is exactly what that is. It is racism because you're judging the person based off the color of his skin and not by his personality because you already dismiss a black man because of his skin color because you even get to know who he is as a person meaning you don't like the race not the person in general because you don't even know the person. I know it's racism because if you were in a pitch black room with men of all color but you didn't know and you had a conversation with all of them and you liked all their personalities and then they turn on the lights and you see the guy you liked the most was black you would forget the connection and leave it alone because he is black. It's not fair that it seems like black men have been dealt a bad hand and it's like we are constantly being punished or hated and gay people are more accepted than black men. Now with what I am saying you know I am talking about how women look at black men because I don't really care how men look at us. See I am going to break it down when it comes to different ethnicities of women:
Asian Women: They hardly like black men unless they are more Americanized and have more of an urban lifestyle with urban friends. If the Asian woman was raised in a more traditional household she will not be into black men at all because her family has taught her that white and Asian men are the best and black men are the worst. Even though white men have done more to Asian culture than any other race and Asian people have been having wars against each other since the beginning of time and black men haven't done anything to them.
Middle Easter Women: Basically the same thing as Asian women where they are taught that black men are the lowest of the low. Even though white men have done the most to their culture.
White Women: Now this is something different because mostly skinny women who were raised in mostly white neighborhoods don't like black men because they mostly go for the same type of white guy, the ones that look like they go to the beach and all that. The white women who do like black men are the ones who are thicker in body shape or who have been raised in a diverse neighborhood or the white women who try to rebel against their parents so they date black men just to make their family upset. Also the bigger white women like black men because black men have been known to like bigger women where white men judge them the most.
Black Women: Now this is a bit strange because there are still some black women who like black men but it seems most of the time those women are the women who are too ghetto or hood and they don't really have nothing going for themselves. The black women who have things going for themselves mostly stray towards the white men because they feel that white men treat them better and everything. Once again even though white men have done the most to their culture.
Hispanic Women: They are kind of the same as the Asian and Middle Eastern women for the fact that their taste in men depends on the way that they were raised.
I know people don't like to hear the truth but there it is, and you wonder why black men are mad a lot, wouldn't you be mad a lot if every time somebody looks at you they can be thinking racist things in their minds. The fact that we have to be famous and have money and all that just to get a beautiful woman's attention when all a white guy has to do is have a pulse. This isn't a fairytale where the underdog comes out victorious because we black men are the underdog and we will remain the underdogs because of women. It is also messed up for the fact that women mostly like to use black men in a sexual way and most of the time just see us like that instead of in an intellectual way. I know this is a rant and I should put it in the rant section but I had to get this out so whether you read it or not I don't care, because the fact of the matter is that you ladies are the reason why people are still separated and hatred has grown more than love.

title: Looking for that one lady that needs help!
text:
The story is played out in ads on Craigslist thousands of times a day. Most you'll find in the casual encounters section.

Yes, men on this type of quest are a cent a thousand. No one bends over to pick up a penny. Perhaps I can convince you that I am the pearl that awaits you on the shore.

I did for a moment consider posting this in "casual encounters" but after reflection realized that I don't belong in "casual encounters." What I seek is very very far from casual. I'm seeking an enduring passionate affair.

Let's get past the preliminaries. Of course there's nothing unique about a married man seeking a woman for carnal pursuits. I claim no distinction there.

What might be unique is that I'm seeking a very special long term monogamous relationship with a woman for reasons beyond carnal conquest. There is no thirst for me in quantity but there is a great thirst for quality. And there is consummate patience in my quest.

I am seeking that feeling of wholeness that I once had... most importantly I desire pursuits of the mind, the heart, the soul. If I can find that then I surely know that the body will follow willingly and completely. This is a pursuit of mutual trust and a journey that I wish to be enduring. This is not a cry for a single encounter.

She knows who she is. She may be trapped in circumstances of necessary commitment, but she is a woman invisible, unfulfilled and unappreciated. She stares in the mirror in the morning wondering what she is doing differently to not be noticed.

She rifles through her closet baffled why the magic that some of these more enticing garments used to achieve has now dissipated. She mediates yet another loud argument at the dinner table over something so trivial but cosmically consequential and thus becomes the villain in the play.

She falls asleep at night next to warmth and breathing, longing to be touched and cared for and desired the way she was just a blink of an eye turned into an eternity ago.

I know her well because I am her male counterpart. Tell me your tale and you have written mine.

I know you - I've seen you in my fantasies. You are attractive, sensual, open, adventurous, playful, and most importantly intelligent. And although you have agonized over the potential guilt the decision to read my ad has brought you, you are open to a nontraditional-nonpossessive- nondrama arrangement with an attentive, caring, and giving gentleman who will treat you with kindness, adoration, civility, and fill the emptiness in your being.

Who are you? You are of no particular age, body style or ethnicity. You do however have a positive outlook, the desire to be wanted and needed. You live for the anticipation, the craving and adoration that you richly deserve, and you in return so sweetly give all of that willingly in return.

Who am I?

I'm safe, sane, attractive, very attentive and I love to please. I'm a romantic, a sentimentalist, a conversationalist, a good listener, but most importantly I can be a friend. Physically I am athletically built, brown eyes, bright, professional, 40ish, well educated, patient, contemplative, caring, considerate, and enjoy a little Kink.

For career & family reasons discretion is paramount, and must never be an issue ..

If you haven't guessed it by now, this is not an offer for just any woman. It's an offer for a very special woman. I know it will appeal to few and my search has potential to be a long and frustrating one. But I can wait! And I do hope you will find me eventually.

If this is you, please write me. Put "invisible" in the subject line so I'll know it's not spam. MUST SEND A FEW PICTURES WITH THE FIRST EMAIL SHOWING HEAD AND BODY PLEASE!!
SERIOUS INQUIRES ONLY PLEASE!! VERY GENEROUS ALLOWANCE FOR THE RIGHT LADY!!

Let's become visible again together.

title: A terrible date
text:
Here are the hurdles I have encountered dating:
- I travel, a lot, for work. (Setting up a first or subsequent dates is difficult and awkward.)
- I don't ask a lot of questions. (If you want me to know something you will tell me.)
- I am not the most outgoing person I know.
- I use language and describe things that offend or otherwise bother other people.
- My taste in music tends to give people the wrong impression.
- I live alone and kind of enjoy it.
- I never want to be married. (That doesn't mean I can't commit, but I want to know we are in a relationship simply because we want to be, not because we don't want to deal with messy paperwork and the legal system.)
- I do not want children. (They would prevent us from doing the things we want to do. Dogs are OK.)
- I am by no means "Progressive", "Liberal", "Left-Leaning", or any of those other words they use to describe the socialist party in this country.
- I am not 'Right-Leaning" either... Anarchy is my preferred form of government. So my views are a tad extreme and I tend to keep them to myself unless I have consumed too much whiskey. *sip*

The rewarding side of dating someone like myself:
- I am self sufficient. (You wouldn't have to worry about me being a deadbeat boyfriend.)
- I clean up after myself.
- I can fix anything. (MacGyver would be jealous of my skills.)
- I can solve a myriad of problems. (Sometimes using one problem as the solution to another problem.)
- I can introduce you to new things.
- You will get plenty of affection.

In an ideal relationship:
- You would consider yourself a true equal.
- I would respect you as a true equal.
- You would still have to let me open doors for you.
- We would find a myriad of things to experience together.
- We would look to step out of our comfort zones together.
- We would engage in a life long relationship that flies by because we are having fun.

If any of this sounds agreeable to you I would love to hear from you. I don't smoke, or do drugs. I would prefer if you didn't either. I do drink beer, not the kind of drinker that pulls down a 30 pack of bud light in a day. I only drink good stuff (Dark Beer) and I don't get drunk often.... once or twice a year at best.

Hope to hear from you.

I graduated with an MS in Pharmacology & Toxicology and a MPH in Health Education from Michigan State University (Go Spartans!) on 4-May-2012 and my undergraduate studies were at Arizona State University and Northern Arizona University respectively.

I have a positive outlook on life and work on remaining healthy physically, mentally and spiritually. title: MY CL Dating experience so far
text:
I've had several interesting experiences with the ladies in SF. I may not be stinking rich, but I'm sweet, cordial, independent and fit. SF is an interesting place, and I've met a whole lot of characters... 



The Rich Girl Wannabe 

This girl happens to be a walking billboard for Chanel, D&G;, & LV. She drives a Mercedes SLK convertible. Everything looks perfect and you'd think I hit the jackpot? Wrong! Upon closer inspection, I find out she's a cashier at a clothing store and is just barely getting by because she's so maxed out on loans and credit cards. But hey, she looks like a million bucks. 



The Ambitious Lawyer 

Next date, I met this sharp, articulate Lawyer. Smart, stable, and got respect right? She tells me she hates her job and her life. Her parents pushed her into it, but she's making good dough now. Too bad she owes 250k to loans and she's working like a slave to the MAN. She has high spending standards, so it would be difficult for her to change careers. 



The Party Girl 

Nothing gets you jaded about love until you've met the Party Girl. I met her and fell like a ton of bricks. She's got a smoking body and a face like an angel. Unfortunately, four other suitors are also in love with her. She's playing everyone like a flute. Oh, almost forgot to mention about the cocaine habit. 



Biological Clock Girl 

This one didn't even reach the first date. I looked her up and we traded emails. I got her number and called her. The conversation felt like a job interview and I'm sure she has a checklist in front of her. Lady, you've gotta press the snooze button on that clock. 



The "I hate Asian Culture" Asian Girl 

I don't know what happened with her past relationships, but this girl hates anything that has to do with her own culture. Bitchier than Ling Woo, she tells me where to take her for dinner. White dudes, this one will be looking for you soon in the CL personals titled "SAF for SWM". 



The Drunk Christian 

Ok, I met this girl through friends and we all went to a club. I could tell that she was very attracted to me "like bees to honey" or was it because she had been drinking? I didn't care, I liked her because she seemed fun in a wacky way. A few days later, I asked for the number and she wouldn't give it to me because I was not Christian. W...T...F? Didn't Jesus hang out with prostitutes, thieves, and lepers? Well, next time I see her, I will be sure to bring along a six pack of beer. 



The Social Climber 

I went to a nightclub and met The Social Climber(s). You know, the ones that judge you from two questions, what do you do and how old are you. From the answer, they can tell everything about you like a psychic. If you don't answer doctor, lawyer, or banker, you will never get laid. 



The Amateur Goldigger 

Well, a girl contacted me after reading this post and she wanted to just be friends. I said, "sure", we could all use a new friend. I ask her out to meet at a friendly lunch and she requested that I pick her up and to also pay. Usually, I'm very generous with my friends and treating is not a problem. To ask me to pay in advance seems tacky, especially since we haven't met and it isn't a date. I had to cancel on this event. 



The Accidental Craigslister(s) 

I seem to be getting replies from women starting like this: "I was searching for a job, and I accidentally found your ad." or "I was bored, and somehow found your posting." or "I was selling my computer, and stumbled upon your ad." As if some computer virus possessed them to click on M4W and somehow prompted them write an email reply. It's OK to be on the internet searching for love. Many people have found their significant other to "complete them". It's OK to make a new friend through the net, trust me I'm completely harmless. 



SO WHAT AM I LOOKING FOR? 

How about some honest fun, conversation, and actual activity TONIGHT over a glass of something wonderful? I have my own place.How about you being a happy, emotionally stable, and loving person yourself? A sense of humor would be necessary, because I can be a wise-ass. Write to me.



PS: I am not bitter (actually optimistic). Do not think I hate women--actually love, respect and cherish them more than anything in the world. If I don't make fun of these people, I would go nuts. Also, I find my experience to be oddly educating and I hope you enjoyed them. =)

title: Pick Me! Pick Me! Pick Me! No really, I mean it and I'm not a donkey!
text:
From what I gather, when women place promising ads here, they get dozens and sometimes hundreds of replies. Sure, many are no good, but --- when once in a blue moon I place one looking for a woman, I get maybe one or three replies. Surely, that could mean that my posts suck ;-) but I don't think so...

Why is there such chasm between these two worlds? Why must I compete so hard? And hard it is, because unlike some, I am intensely private. Posting a photo here would never occur to me.

And then I read in some women's posts how men write one-liner replies, how they don't read the full post even though it was only three paragraphs, and how men just hit women up for a pic, demand 'no baggage' and 'no drama' -- wow ... shocking to me, because *I* get one-liner replies even when my post it substantial and asks to please respond to what I've written. I get requests for pics right off the bat. And I get responses that clearly show that my post hadn't been read at all.

I'm a great man, and dismayed at most responses I get. I'm honest, up-front, I show up, AND I'm really good looking - if I can say that without conceit ;-) CAN a man say that about himself without cockery?

So - what am I seeking? A lover. Monogamous, exclusive, in the open, with nobody else upset about it, like unfinished relations. Why just a lover? Simple: because physical chemistry has to be there for longer things to develop, and I think it's unrealistic to find that long-term partnership with a few paragraphs of description about self and desired partner. So, one step at a time. Besides, isn't intimacy the most nourishing thing on earth? When it's great of course. 

And I want great. And respectful, kind, caring, close - it makes intimacy so much better. No need to hide shit or pretend there's no wounds or fears or desires. Come as you are. It's a wonderful world if we make it so.

What about me you wonder? Well, English is my third language, I live by myself, let's say within 30min of the golden gate (it would be great if you did too), I work in the creative performance world, I'm into strong fitness myself (couldn't do really overweight, my apologies - though femininly curvaceous is great), love hikes and nature, I'm tall for sure, and have been called dashing and sexy. I'm not an ageist, so if you're young or old, that's ok - as long as we resonate and whatever we do works for both of us - in a really good way! Depending on who you ask, I'm below 40 or above 50. A former girlfriend affectionately refered to me as a "Cuddle Slut" & while we laughed about it at the time she was also correct. I enjoy and thrive off touch and I treasure touch on it's own merits as opposed to just being a precursor to sex. 

While I'm single and not looking for a committed relationship I also have to admit that I miss cuddling & touching even more than I do sex. Spooning, either as the big or little spoon; holding & being held; finding any excuse to touch each other.

I've been involved with wonderful women who are kind, intelligent, attractive and sexually adventurous yet not really receptive to touch outside of sexual contact. I'm a poor match for those woman.

So what am I looking for here on Craigslist? 
- Somebody fun who enjoys touch as much as I do.
- Would enjoy hanging out once a week and watching movies, eating pizza and touching (see above).
- Let's be friends as well as cuddle buddies.
- Local to the Peninsula is preferred.

I realize that if we do cuddle on an ongoing, extended basis there's a great chance that we'll also want to have sex. That's cool. Not right away though and I don't want sex to become the point or the objective as opposed to the pure cuddling. 

If this idea interests you and you'd like to learn more about me please feel free to get in touch, I'll be happy to share my picture and any other details that you may be curious about.

title: A million to one shot
text:
Really, what are the odds of someone like you finding a LTR on Craigslist?
You're not a "sports fan". You rarely drink. You don't smoke or do drugs. You're over-educated, but practical-minded. Successful, cosmopolitan and yet down-to-earth. Multi-faceted, well-traveled and self-aware. 

Basically, you're a highly-hyphenated, and potentially overly-caffeinated woman. You know how to use adverbs well enough that it's not so easy to find true compatibility. Not only that, but your keen sense of humor falls flat more than you'd like... largely BECAUSE you're so hyphenated. Maybe because your mind sees the between-the-lines subtleties that many don't, it's a little harder to connect deeply. But, you're warm, kind, and just optimistic enough to think, "maybe." ...Maybe Craigslist. 

Maybe it is possible for you to find another mentally and physically fit, attractive, creative human who ALSO has the opposite-gender-who-likes-the-opposite-gender thing going on. Lord (the one you don't believe in) knows that finding true compatibility outside CL is tough, but CL? 

Half of the men are married and looking for a fwb for Wednesday afternoons. Half smell like cabbage in July. And, the other half can't do simple math. So, what are your chances? None... if you don't say hello when you get a sense that, maybe, just maybe, you found someone special.

title: A younger girl for a friendship
text:
I'm sure most people might question my motives on this but there aren't any bad intentions with this. I'm looking for a younger girl for a friendship. This would be someone to hang out with once or twice a week. We can go out, stay in or whatever. I'm down for going to events like concerts, comedy shows or sporting events. I like dining out. That can be a fancy restaurant or some of those awesome hole in wall places that are in the city. I'm perfectly good with paying for all our activities. I'm not looking for arm candy or anything of the sort. I don't have a problem dating. This can be strictly a friendship without any expectations of anything else happening. The reason why I want a younger female friend is that, it's so refreshing to hang out with someone younger. Everyone I work with is my age or older. My friends are slightly younger but for the most part set in their same boring routine. I miss having female friends too. It's more difficult to find than you would think. Girls will either think I'm into them or they will be into me if I ask them to hang out just the two of us. That's why I think a decent age difference is a good thing. It puts a little barrier there than with someone closer to either of our ages. I'm great at giving advice and I am someone that actually cares and will be there for my friends. I think everyone can use someone like that. 
So, I'm thinking of someone 18-22. Anyone older gets into that dateable age, ha ha. Actually I have dated in that 18-22 range but I do have a conscious and whether it was the situation or not, I felt I was taking advantage there. Let me know your thoughts or if you have any questions for me.

title: Fun and active FWBs
text:
I have been single for a few months and I am in the mind set to meet someone new. A playful, witty and active woman. A woman to enjoy an flirty outing, some cuddling, make out and see where things go. Looking for something longer term than a one night stand, but less than something that leads to full time co-habitation.

I want the friendship, the ability to enjoy doing things together, having fun, the companionship as well the physical relationships. We can go hikes, city explorations, check out the museums, scope of the foodie scene, order delivery, take in a movie or two, check out live music, go dancing and such. We can even just laze out together in comfortable solitude. You have your cool pad, I have mine and we typically end up at mine with occasional rendezvous at yours.

I am single, with a busy career that I enjoy,leads an active life. I am outgoing, friendly and have a happy-go-lucky outlook on life. I am a flirt with a sense of humor, a social being with a cheerful vibe. Work hard during the week and comfortable meeting up on a week night. Enjoy doing a lot of things on the weekends, but not ashamed to take a lazy sunday to unwind. A city explorer who frequently spends long hours walking through SF and the many hills, checking out the various city areas, restaurants, murals, people, sights and sounds of the area. A stocky, fairly fit guy who could use more gym time to shade the extra weight.

Looking for a laid back, friendly female who can be open to a friends with benefits connection with a nice, affectionate, normal guy. An active woman who wants a fun male companion who can be a charming fun gentleman when it counts yet is subtly dominant when the occasion calls for. A woman who is independent and has her own busy work and social life yet wants our time and space to intersect regularly as we enjoy our time together irrespective of what we are doing. A fairly fit woman who is not afraid to jump puddles in the rain yet ever-ready to dress up for a night on the town.

If you are interested please send a response that includes your physical description, the things you enjoy doing, what tickled your fancy and what area you are in. Though I seek something in SF due to the ease of spontaneity, I am open to other fairly local surrounding locations if there is a good connection. My last FWB was from Santa Cruz. I probably will not respond to messages that do not contain enough information of the writer. Please put your favorite activity and your neighborhood in the subject.

Thanks for your time. Good luck in your search.

title: The beauty in being of service
text:
The beauty in being of service

From a fairly early age, I have made efforts to help others. Perhaps, when I was young, I wanted to be liked or did so to avoid conflict. But there always was a sense of doing good by making another person's life easier and more enjoyable.

I know this topic risks becoming a philosophic discussion. After all, do we ever do anything strictly for the benefit of someone else? Even giving a dollar to a homeless person is not pure altruism, as it makes us feel better or less guilty.)

Today, as a middle-aged adult, I continue to be of service. I help when and where I can, in a variety of ways, and often anonymously. This is one way of feeling connected to the world, and to contribute my share to the greater good. I believe that serving others has a ripple effect: kindness expands into an ever-increasing circle. (There is a worthwhile TED Talk on the web by Kelly McGonical: How to make stress your friend. I found it quite interesting, especially the last part, where she quotes studies that proved that caring about/for others actually increases your physical resilience.)

Aside from being of service, I am an active and loving man. Smart, nurturing, creative, and firm. I own two businesses, was born on a different continent, have an adult daughter, and a love of nature. I have an active spiritual side, but am not religious.

This is a condensed yet -- in the World of Craigslist -- still lengthy introduction to the kind of partner I seek. An open-minded woman who wishes to be of service to her partner and surroundings, and who knows the deep sense of joy and satisfaction this brings. We know this is a process that develops over time, as the experience of and with each other brings increased trust and a sense of belonging.

If these words strike a chord, please write me and say a few words about who you are and what you seek. I do not have a laundry list of deal-breakers, but first and foremost I ask that you are earnest and available, both emotionally and physically. Hopefully you are healthy and in decent shape. If you live in or near central Marin that would be great, yet for the right person I do not mind a somewhat greater distance. As to age, I am open to women late thirties to early fifties. And if I can persuade you to include a photo that is recent and without sunglasses, that would be wonderful.

title: ●●● Lets walk this path together ●●●
text:
It's weird how as the world gets more and more tech-savvy we as people we get more and more distant. We keep thinking "Soon I'll have that person" but never say "Today I'll have that person." Why - there is always the chance that tomorrow someone better comes along. In the meantime we go about our daily life and see all of these people who we could potentially have amazing moments with, friendships, cheers, laughters, or even a soulmate for life.

We all have our preferences, who knows, maybe you and I don't hit it off. All good. That's life. At least we can say we tried and go from there. Maybe you can give me some honest and needed feedback on how I can improve myself, and maybe I can return the favor.

If we open our eyes we find amazing people wherever we look, on each continent, in each race, in each religion. I am very open to meet someone who shares the same multi-cultural mindset. title: Realness: Never Settle For Less
text:
Let's be real, it gets very tiresome trying to meet people out and about. You meet plenty of people who are looking for a good time and just want to "hang out" and everyone seems to have the same things to say and the same intentions. Not what I'm looking for anymore. Been there, done that. Some qualities I look for in a person are honestly, loyalty, intelligence, patience, integrity and humor - in every sense of the word. I'm the type of person who finds humor and joy in everything. I look for those same characteristics as well because in my opinion, without humor, laughter and acceptance, life would be pretty dull!

I'm genuine and straight-forward, what you see is what you get. •No baggage •Don't smoke •Never married •No kids: prefer the same. I'm friendly, loyal and gentle. I tend to be go-with-flow, easy going and good-natured. I'm not into drama or mind games: I have purpose and intention with how I live my life and intentionally hurting others is not one. I enjoy music, movies, sports, binge-watching shows, deep conversation or just chatting at a coffee shop and so much more. I especially love the outdoors and having fun. I like to take off into the mountains or along the ocean and see the wonderment of nature in everything. I'm cultured and love learning new things especially something from everyone I meet. I'm grateful for each interaction in life and appreciate when one opens up to me and shares.

I'm looking for someone with good values to build with whom I feel a nice, genuine connection while not rushing into anything, taking things at whatever speed feels natural and see where it lands. That said, as I'm not a serial dater nor am I into meaningless hookups, I am looking for that lady that possess the potential to be "the one". Someone to laugh at my jokes, experiment with new things and introduce me to things that mean a lot to them. I am looking to share my life as well as understand theirs. I am warm, compassionate, honest and extremely independent. Things I value in a relationship: equality, knowing yourself and what you want and need, honesty, self-confidence and self-respect.

Nothing Worth Having Is Easy: You're responsible with your declarations, promises and back those words up with actions. You have self-awareness and self-knowledge to understand when words flutter out your mouth, having the decency to follow through with them. Trust, loyalty and love are all earned. You don't get them just because you're a good person. Doing right is the standard, and though it's appreciated, you don't get extra credit for it. I just believe there's more to being a "good one" than just being a good person. Your presence should improve things, and your energy should inspire. If we're going to be close, we should be making each other better. I don't believe in keeping people around for no reason. Your presence should have a purpose. I want to feel honored to know you.

I want to hear from you with a pic for a response if you're a fun down to earth lady that wants to find a chill guy to spend time with to build a great friendship that can lead to a life time partnership. I dislike the games and won't chase you: I feel like it should be mutual and think life is way too short to play them and beat around the bush so when you like someone you should dive straight in. I respect a lady who knows what she wants, goes after it and has no problems putting it out there. If you have a desire to get to know someone on a deep, meaningful level, and want to put the effort into communicating and seeing each other, sharing ideas, having discussion and not relying solely on text messages but rather use it in conjunction with calling when getting to know someone. Not feeling all that dating nonsense either. If it's right, it should be casual and fun, easy to maintain and contain laughter and a mutual pursuit of our passions.

I only want real people around me...That really want to be around me...This is when you really care enough to call to each other out if sliding off track so I respect someone who can keep me accountable. A healthy relationship is one where two individuals strive to make each other better to become the best version of themselves they can be.

title: Hoping to make a friend... please and be pleased. - 40s
text:
Thanks for checking out my ad.

Not sure if CL is the right place for finding what I'm looking for, but trying it out. For sure you should know that I am not a habitual CL poster.

Basically, I am a married man looking for a woman for friendship and the affection that I am missing. I am not the type to prowl the bars etc. and play games with a woman so I can get what I want. Just because I have come to terms with the fact that I need to find someone outside my marriage, I still don't need the additional guilt. So here I am!

First off, let me make it clear that I am in no way looking to change my home situation. I do love and I am devoted to my family. It is a tricky situation that is not easy to explain (not that I would on CL, LOL) but the bottom line is, I have been feeling the need for what I am missing for a while now and have not acted on it for obvious reasons. Now, after a few years, I've realized that this lack of balance in my life is creating more bad than good, so I am looking to fix that.

More about me... I'm a white, educated man, in my 40s, living in San Francisco. I am very fit, good looking (at least that's how I see it :-)) and energetic. I very much enjoy being active. To me stagnation is the true "killer."

I'm the clean-cut, professional type and clean in every way. I take pride in taking care of myself, inside and out. I am also very laid back and easy going. I take people for who they are which includes the good and the bad. I don't judge and don't like being judged. For sure, as you get to know me you will feel very comfortable being yourself around me.

I'm here hoping to find a friend that I can see on a regular basis for conversation and more. I don't care if you are also married or not just as long as you will accept me as I am. Age (older or younger) or race is not important to me as confidence and physical attraction is. If you are not supper fit, that's fine. That's also not a priority for me. What I hope to find is someone who will be motivated to make me happy like I will want to make her happy... someone who is fun under the sheets (or above them :-)) without hang-ups. Having confidence in yourself and knowing what you want will create that situation, not your body measurements, age, race, etc.

Sexually I am very open, meaning, very sex-positive. I like everything from sensual to "porn-style" sex. It all comes down to mood and the company I am keeping. It's really all about pleasing and being pleased. To me sex, if with the right person, is a fun and great adventure we can take... an opportunity to step away from normal life for a while and a way to feed all our senses. So ideally I would love to find someone with a similar mindset.

Beyond this, I will also add here that I am self-employed which means my time is very flexible so I am able to meet during the day as well as evenings. So I don't see any issues with finding the time to get together and hang out.

Hoping for some quality responses... let's see how it goes. :-) Please put "SPECIAL FRIEND" in the subject line so I know you're at least not some bot.

Thanks and hope to hear from you.

(Attached pic is not me but a good representation of what I'm like. Real pics once I hear back and realize there is potential.)

title: Showing Yourself Off
text:
Greetings,
Wasn't quite sure where to post this but here goes...

I am hoping to find a woman who might find my support and friendship useful.

Are you thrilled by subtly showing yourself off in public?

I am referring to completely "acceptable" appearances, yet revealing enough that, for those with eyes and a taste for such things, quite a lot can be seen.

Nothing that would alert the morality police, or worse, of course.

If you occasionally thrill from being observed, or perhaps have long fantasized about doing such things, please read on.

I'm a sane, sophisticated man in my 50's. Tall, healthy. I adore a woman who "owns" this sort of activity.
I'm seeking a friend for whom I can offer support.
I don't expect any sort of sexual interaction between us. What I'd like to do is simply go out with you, for example to a dept. store mid-day, a mall and, while not appearing to be with you, remain near enough that, for one, I can watch you let yourself be seen as well as observe reactions to you. I also can cover you such that, should anyone be too forward in approaching you, I can step in and negate unwanted interaction.
If it appeals to you I can also take stills or video of your activities although that's not at all a huge deal.

It's really quite simple. I want to find a lady friend who is turned on by tasteful forms of showing herself. Cleavage. Braless. Short skirts. Tight pants. The list goes on, of course, but the main thing is that YOU are deeply aroused by showing yourself to strangers in a public setting.

In my personal life I've known numerous women for whom this was a profoundly exciting thing to do. Most, however, didn't partake simply because they were concerned about unwanted interactions with folks they'd come across.

My participation negates the potential for hassles and gives you clear leeway. For us both it would be deeply arousing.

I pick you up or meet you at the location of your choosing and simply follow close enough to see you, far away enough to seem like we're not together. You walk around, shop, show yourself to anyone of interest and, some time later, we break camp and go our separate ways. This could be ongoing or a one-time thing. Both would be cool with me although ongoing would be fabulous!!

If this piques your interest please get in touch. On the surface I suppose it's a bit pervy but the reality is, I'm totally sane and together and genuinely want the interaction to be on this level. It's not a scam to get in yer pants. Seriously.

Please get in touch. If it's of interest it's worth some communicating!

best!

title: Female Led Relationship
text:
Thanks for clicking on my ad. Perhaps you know what the title means, but if you don't, you should google it. In short, I'm looking for a traditional 1950s marriage, except the other way around, and with an extra helping of kink. ;) I love the idea of being a stay at home dad, taking care of the home and the children, and supporting you in your high power career.

In today's world the traditional model of the career husband and the stay at home wife seems more dated than ever. Women are better at planning, lateral thinking, and social intelligence, and these are the very skills that are most needed in the workplace today. And you can see this in universities where now 60% of students are women. I believe that in the future we will see more and more woman in positions of power since on the whole women are much more suited to the role. In contrast, men are physically stronger and are good at linear problem solving, which are attributes that are better suited to caring for the home.

Growing up, the women in my family were always the breadwinners, so for me the traditional idea that a man is the head of the household has never made much sense. I've never much enjoyed the macho role that men are expected to play, and am much more interested in exploring a relationship with a woman who knows what she wants, and has a place for a man to play second fiddle and follow her lead. I love a strong take-charge attitude. Not cruel, but firm, and confident enough to put her wants and needs first in a relationship knowing that I get my fulfillment from supporting her, submitting to her, and following her lead.

If we have daughters, I want them to know that their mother wears the pants in the relationship, and I want to support them in becoming the strong confident female leaders of the future. And if we have sons, I want to raise them with respect and deference to all women; and I want them to see how their father always defers to their mother, and to understand that that is the key to a harmonious marriage.

Of course, some of this can play out in our sexual dynamic behind closed doors, and I'm very excited to see what could develop there. (Isn't sex an expression of everything else in a relationship anyway?) I want to find a woman who isn't afraid to take what she wants sexually either. Ever wanted a guy to go down on you for 2 hours straight while you ignore him and watch reruns of your favorite tv shows? I'd love to do that, and as often as you like. There are lots of possibilities, but if that sort of thing appeals to you, then we might have good chemistry. I also believe that in a female led relationship, monogamy applies to the man only. I believe that it is natural for a woman to seek variety in her sexual partners at different times, and that as her husband it is not my place to stop her and try to control her. Rather, it is my place to be her stability and place of love and security that she can always return to.

I'm 29, white with brown hair and blue eyes, average height, educated, and considered attractive. I have many interests and love good conversation, good food, walks in nature, and caring for my partner. And while formal education isn't strictly required, I do want my partner to be strong, confident, and articulate. And on a path to career that will support our family comfortably. Also please be early twenties to mid-thirties; in other words, age appropriate.

title: Average Man Seeking not your average conenction
text:
So I started out with this trying to figure out how to write an ad the would attract responses, but the more I thought about it, the more I realized the goal isn't responses; it should be a connection. I want a connection, one that starts out as someone who enjoys my company as I do theirs. Someone who looks forward to spending time with me as I do them. That can blossom and grow not just in to a beautiful flower but also has strong roots to weather storms. 

I'm not someone who leads an extra ordinary life, you wont find me searching out heart pounding thrills on a daily basis. I'm an average guy, I have a career as well as a side job to make ends meet. I have condo that I share with a room mate. I am divorced and have two kids from that marriage. I'm not now or will I ever be the most interesting am on the planet. What I have is a big heart, loyalty, passion for love, a desire to help others when I can, a strong sense of humor, and a smile that is both genuine and occasionally used as a mask to hide behind as well.

I want to find my connection. Its not easy and I'm not sure if it is supposed to be or not. All I know for sure is I was not meant to travel this word without you at my side. I have tried to travel the paved roads as well as forged my own path trying to find this connection I so desire. I have been told to stop looking but to me that feels like giving up, its call the "pursuit of happiness" not the sit around and wait for happiness.

I guess if you've made it this far you are probably wondering about who I am; so here is how I describe myself:

First the Facts.

I am thirty four, 5'9" roughly 250 lbs. I have blue eyes and dark brown hair. I have several tattoos and plans for more.

I am Divorced with 2 kids (ages 12 & 8), My kids live out of state and we all travel to see each other as much as we can.

I Like to go on nature walks and hike new areas. I like to hear peoples stories and learn more about the world. I try not too hold hate in my heart but in reality it is there. I like photography and art. I like spending time with family. I enjoy TV and movies but like getting out into the world just as much. I ramble on when I'm nervous and have been told I talk too much sometimes. 

I drink on occasion, I quit smoking over a year ago but its a daily struggle still. I don't do any types of drugs . I curse too much and can be overly oblivious.

I have fought my weight for the last ten years. I started off close to four hundred pounds and am working on getting it down to a healthier number. I had awakening last year and that has really put the fire in my belly to get it down.

So if my long ad about mediocrity intrigues you at all, let me know. Lets talk and see how things go.

Cause we cant see if there is a connection unless we try right?

If you could put Average in your subject line so I can tell your real I would appreciate it.

Thanks

title: Free massage! Relax and unwind for a bit
text:
I like to practice massage as a hobby but don't get to practice often enough. I'm offering free massage to cool and interesting people to indulge my hobby in 2016 with bodies in need of healing. Sore after a month of New Years' resolutions? Crumbling after blocking and tackling your way through Super Bowl City? Stressed from hunching over a desk at the office? Massage your tensions away!

Years ago I interned as an orthopedic surgeon, learned physical therapy and Chinese rehabilitation techniques, and put daily stresses on my body playing and coaching soccer. I now write software by day, dabbling in other creative pursuits such as winemaking and cute puppies on evenings and weekends. Massage is a hobby, not a career, and therefore not worth the time and expense of certifications or room rentals. I live alone in a one-bedroom loft in SoMa. I use a padded massage table, hot and cold buckwheat pads, using pressed coconut and other natural creams and oils to sooth your skin, penetrate muscles, and leave you loosened and reshaped. I'll crank up the heat, keeping you warm, comfortable, and draped as the rain falls outside.

I'm 33, straight, single, and sane. I realize you may be skeptical of craigslist and this post probably appears next to someone wanting his hamster to lick your toes, but it does seem like a better way to find people interested in massage than posting a flyer on the bulletin board at Rainbow Grocery or something similar.

I enjoy learning the uniqueness of your body, its accumulated stresses, its extra sensitivities, and customize a massage as I learn. I'm able to operate outside the confinements of a spa menu or its modalities, tune-in to change, and go with the flow. Working on someone over time is best, leading to some good past projects healing runners, students hunched over desks studying, or someone who really likes the relaxing escape.

I don't like working with people who have had bad injuries that should really be under the care of a doctor or chiropractor. You should bathe regularly, be under 35 for good body recovery, have a pleasant demeanor, and be relatively in shape for good access to muscles and general body feedback. No spray-on tans or cyborg body parts. Hopefully you've hugged a puppy and helped confused tourists at some point in your life!

Long post! If you're still reading and curious you should send an email to let me know a little about you. Whereabouts do you live? Do you have a particular area of stress or tension screaming for attention? Which activities do you think might have thrown it out of whack?

Feel free to ask questions beyond what this already long posting provides. We could meet at a cafe or lounge after exchanging a few emails, learn what you enjoy in a massage, and work through some of the uncertainties meeting a stranger. Craigslist can deliver good apartments and furniture, why not a massage?

I live alone near the SoMa - Mission border about two blocks away from Muni trains. I am available Friday evening or Saturday. Send an email to explore new possibilities and kick off body healing and relaxation.

title: Why woman hate FWB term ? I hate it too! Only?
text:
I think the problem is that "FWB" is a code for uncommitted, emotionally distant sex. If you'll indulge me in some generalization...men and women approach friendship differently. Women share everything with their girlfriends, or almost everything. They seek that close intimate bond. Most but not all men are just...different. I think they are more likely to have "bros" or chums who come over and watch the game. More casual, looser. Over the past 100 years as we exited the "partner up so you can survive" times, male-female relations have centered around a careful negotiation of these two approaches. Now that seems to be falling apart giving changing societal morels. It's really easy to have quick sex, sex without real emotional closeness. Physical intimacy is a short cut, a way for people to avoid emotional closeness that comes with long term commitment.

The good news is that there are a lot of options between disconnected "FWB" and marriage. Take me for example. Yeah, I want a friend with benefits. MY kind of friend with benefits. A lover and a partner to do things with. I'd like sleepovers without cohabitation, and long term dating that is monogamous without needing to know we'll be married in x # of months or years. I'd like someone who is happy to hear from me via text or phone when we're too busy to be together. Someone who has my back...an actual friend. Someone who loves nice quiet times, music, movies, great food, hiking, and crazy good sex. Someone who might like a weekend away or, gasp...maybe a vacation eventually, if we're really hitting it off.

If you are a woman looking for the same thing - let me know !

Me I desire that in my life, I really think life is a web and we get the opportunity to make the most of it but only a few times to experience, beautiful moments lead to beautiful memories that live on. I was born a romantic, a believer in old movies and fairy tales, my touch is magical to whom I cross, I make others happy, even with my European wit and charm. I have become aware on how to seek the true meaning of living and being happy. Its not easy but it can be magical. Did you ever lay with a lover out on a hill, ,over looking the ocean, just finished a beautiful picnic, the warmth of the sea air blowing across each bodies, as both of ye smile and kiss , your bodies entangled in each other, wanting to make that moment last forever... that's what life should be about, simple beautiful moments like that or similar.... Hope I didn't bore you with my ranting... just me, whom I really am....

title: Emotionally mature tattooed man for serious fwb or open relationship.
text:
Hi. Buckle in for the epic journey! I should start by saying that I am in an open relationship. Don't want anyone to do all this reading if that isn't ok. My facial hair fluctuates, but I am very open to my partner's preferences. If you are outside SF/Daly city/Pacifica, probably won't work. I live near the beach and east bay by bart is 90 minutes or longer each way and driving is an hour or more each way. I just can't see being able to make that a sustainable relationship. So think 30-45 minutes from ocean beach. If you feel like you are my fate destined soul mate and live further, say hi. Otherwise, probably will lead to frustration and heartbreak. So why start that, right? I am open to whatever life throws my way. That is definitely true for relationships. I am open to a variety of types of relationships. Life is too short to have firm expectations. I feel I would most want a long term other primary partner or really close secondary partner. Not seeking a harem! Eeeew. I don't mind if you drink or do drugs in moderation. I don't anymore for quite a long time, but I don't judge. Smoking is ok as long as I don't have to breathe it. 

About me. I just turned 44. I don't feel or look (so I have been told) that age. Whatever that means. I am an extremely honest and ethical person with a strong sense of honor. I have a dark and wicked sense of humor which never translates in these profiles. Somehow they always end up reading really dry and serious. I am something of the reformed bad boy type. I still am a little edgy, while being safe and sane and all grown up.

I am a very gentle, giving, loving and sweet person. I am super affectionate. In a good way. Been told that I am a good kisser and give the best hugs. Also been told that my massages are top notch. I am a very present and attentive partner and a fantastic listener. I am a very good communicator. I am still friendly with just about all my ex's. I am a keeper. Someone will be very lucky to have me. :)

I prefer thick or curvy gals, but really don't care about superficial things like that. If you are skinny but an awesome person, great. I don't care one iota about ethnicity or age, although I am more into women my age or older. Please be disease free and sane. :) 

I am a very open minded, hard working and skilled lover. I am open to passionate vanilla or kinky play depending on my partner. I guess this is a nice little start and I am happy to tell you lots more about me if you email. Thanks for reading!

title: I avoid people, though they'd love for me to join. Can you relate?
text:
The question of course is ... why? The answer is because almost all encounters with people I know are thoroughly predictable to me. Usually, within a fraction of a second before the encounter beginning, I experience the entire encounter that's about to unfold, in that fraction of a timeless second. This is outside linear time. People tend to be predictable. In other words, in that fraction of a second, I've already had the meeting. Then I have to sit through another 10-minute or so rendition of the same meeting. Which I find exhausting. Hence, I avoid most people.

Now, it'll be easy for you to make counter-arguments and say I may miss out on so much, or that if I was only more open, then others would have more room to be different than they were yesterday, or that I am foolish for closing myself off from the unexpected, etc.

None of these great arguments are untrue - however after many years of many experiences, and after knowing myself rather well, when it looks like a duck, sounds like a duck, and walks like a duck - well, then it's probably a duck.

Mind you, I am not happy about avoiding people. It's not that I am basking in the largest circle of wonderful friends ever who knock on my door every day wanting to celebrate me or invite me to the greatest party ever. No, avoiding people is a lonesome way, state, condition if you may.

Can you relate?

I grew up in San Francisco, but have been away for a pretty long time. I used to lead an incredibly energetic life, but now given my age and minor infirmaries have slowed to a crawl, which is not really acceptable. 
I do go to a lot of live music events, and still own a large tent and all of the tent camping things one needs for a comfortable weekend.

I have been thinking about what I might desire in a relationship with a woman. Words which keep coming up are kindness, consideration, warmth, compassion, acceptance, support, the kind of things which would allow one to feel special. You know, the kinds of things you usually think you have, but find that you don't. Hand in hand is fine, but brain to brain might be better. Soul mate? Don't make me laugh. It's hard enough just finding someone who will accept you, let alone the click clack of two souls turning into one. 

I am not interested in seeing a real estate agent, nor an insurance sales person. I am more into people who produce things. People who make their living pushing paper around have never interested me. I have a fondness for people who use their hands as well as their minds, maybe because that was what I did. 

I am pretty simple and straight forward. I am a TV elitist only liking rather intense dramas, and those nutty political shows like Rachael, and Colbert. An 60's Liberal I no longer have a ton of possessions, but what I do have I like and most of it has been with me for a great many years. I do not shop at Wal-Mart, Target, Costco, preferring neighborhood stores. I garden and cook, cook lots of different things, love small parties, and keeping things simple. I do not expect some sort of romantic miracle, as I believe that things grow if meant to. 

I posted this weeks ago and my experiences with the women who have written are baffling. It's like they answer a post from some position resembling auto-pilot. Like they have not read my post. No, I do not want to waste your time, but the gist of where I am coming from is in this post. I have read it again, think it pretty much sums up my thoughts about starting to date, and actually really do think that dating is where it all happens. 

Men, do not bother answering this post, and I am not into larger women.

title: Married But Desire More?
text:
Hello All,

Thanks for taking the time to read my ad amongst so many that are out there. Chances are if, you're like me and odds that you are considering you're reading this, you are either married or attached and there's something missing in your marriage. What is missing is probably passion, romance and intimacy. If that's correct, then we already have something in common. 

I've been with the same woman for 15 years, married for 12 and have one child with her. My child means everything to me and if you have any children, I'm sure you can understand that. 

I have no intention of changing my current relationship because of several reasons and I am not looking to change anyone else's relationship either. What I'm hoping to find is someone who like me, has a void in their personal life and they would like to fill that void. A chance to experience what it is like to get to know someone and feel desire and passion again.

If you're interested and would like to see if we're compatible, feel free to send me and email.

title: Can YOU Relate?
text:

Overall things are pretty good but for some reason the romance and passion in your relationship have seemed to have slipped away. You may or may not know why, but either way you find yourself wanting to feel desired once again. What do you do? title: Lets find our happiness again
text:
You're probably reading this because you've been thinking about stepping out on your boyfriend or spouse. Maybe you've been thinking about it for awhile, maybe a short time...but you wouldn't be here if you hadn't given it some thought. I'm sorry your here like I am looking for something that has been lost in life's complicated Web. But I'm glad your reading this right now! 

Even though you don't want to cheat, you want to change your situation. Whether your married or just dating I feel the same. You're wondering you can have it both ways - the thrill and excitement of an illicit affair and the safety and security of your relationship with your partner. Great news - you can.

I'm in a committed relationship. I have no desire to change my situation, but like you mis that connection we once had.Its been so long.

My relationship will remain my first priority. But I am looking for some "fun on the side" with *one* woman who's also in a relationship that she isn't looking to leave. Discretion, safety, honesty and reliability are the rules of the game. Plus, I hope we can be adults when it's time to say goodbye I know I will be understanding of a ending of our secret relationship and kiss you on the cheek and thank you for the wonderful tomes and wish you the best in life. That's my promise to you. 

Discretion is paramount for people in our situation. I promise absolute and total discretion...I don't need or want to know details about your life that you deem sensitive and I would never do anything to disclose our attachment to anyone. I have no trouble maintaining healthy boundaries with respect to your "real" life. This isn't my first time doing this so be assured that I know how to behave.

Safety is another paramount concern. I highlighted above that I'm only seeking one secret partner. Because my wife is unaware that I'm doing this, I absolutely cannot risk bringing any STDs home. I want someone that shares my hypersensitivity on sexual safety...be assured that I am 100% disease-free and that I won't put you at risk. I require the same commitment from you.

Honesty and reliability also crucial. It may seem ridiculous given the context, but I'm looking for an honest partner. Honesty among thieves :). Honesty facilitates intimacy, and having intimacy in this affair is important for me. It also facilitates the discretion and safety I mentioned above. . I will reciprocate :). 

I'm a nice, normal person with a cool job, several engaging hobbies and lots of friends. I love conversation, watching sports, gardening, reading, card games, woodworking, running and cooking. . I'm funny, affectionate, conscientious, polite, reliable, romantic, sensual, thoughtful...and very friendly. I am unlike the majority of guys on Craigslist: I can spell, use punctuation correctly, write complete and complex sentences(wish I felt the same in school!) and I do not send or ask for inappropriate pictures :).

I'm easy to talk to, so if I've piqued your curiosity please drop me a line and let's chat further. I would be thrilled to speak with you. Happy to answer questions about myself and what I'm seeking (feel free to ask whatever you like), and of course, would love to hear about you. To let me know that you're a real person (and that you read the entire ad) please include the name of your favorite flower in the subject line of your reply. And in case you're wondering - if you are reading this ad, that means I'm still looking for a partner in crime.

title: There are options to your unhappiness
text:
Please let me know of I've left anything out. 

You are married, but the fire has gone out. There is no romance left. If you get any sex at all, it is to please your husband and you are often left unsatisfied. You are developing a more meaningful relationship with the washing machine during an unbalanced spin cycle. You are feeling lonely in your own home. You cautiously look into these alternative solutions hoping something might come to you, but you have never done anything like this. Society has made "affair" a dirty word. You don't want to do anything that might interfere with your family, but there must be more. You start to doubt yourself, 

"Maybe I'm supposed to live with this", "Maybe I don't deserve to be happy". "what have I done to get to this point "? 

I am here to tell you that you deserve to be happy. 

It is your husbands responsibility to take care of you and love you the way he did when you got married (both of you for that matter). Far too often, the man stops spending any energy on the relationship because he can get his needs taken care of in just a few minutes. But you require more effort. It's not your fault, you are a woman, and in my opinion, you are worth the effort. If you are certain your husband has no interest in rekindling your romance and passion, then I have these suggestions:

1. Find a Confidant - make friends with someone in the same situation (like myself) that can relate to what you are going through.

2. Take Time - there is no hurry. There are too many cons and scam artists on CL that you cannot tell who is legitimate. A quick test is to see how long their post is (1 or 2 lines are usually scams).

3. Develop Trust - get to know this confidant. Exchange many e-mails and share similar experiences to build a level of security . Make your confidant earn your trust.

4. Tease Each Other - share romantic thoughts, get playful with sexy stories. This will help you feel alive and remind you of the passion within.

5. Share Your Passion - If you feel comfortable, you can meet with your new friend and share the missing passion and romance that you deserve. 

6. Then look into the mirror, and smile like you used to. 

If you are interested in any of this, I would love to be your confidant. Feel free to ask me any questions. 

I'm here for you. 


If you reply, to weed out any craigslist scammer bots, tell me one one on the subject line that would make you smile. I'm hoping my name will make the list one day. 

Thanks for reading and wishing the of best of luck in your journey.

title: Don't read this if you don't like to laugh
text:
Year 2015 is now in the rear view mirror and 2016 is in diapers. The signs of winter are all around us: the days getting darker earlier, the weather has been cold, and Donald Trump's hairpiece is starting to collect nuts to bury for the winter, etc. Hopefully everyone has recovered from their Xmas and New Years' festivities and aren't still writing "2015" on their checks. 

Since I'm originally from NYC, I recently returned from my trip back east for my annual dose of turkey and family drama with my Italian-American family there. It's was also an opportunity to get a booster shot of my Brooklyn accent, although mine is still one that could make Marisa Tomei jealous despite my decades living in the Bay Area. Of course, I keep my visits short--longer than a week and it can start to resemble a bad episode of "Everybody Loves Raymond."

Kidding aside, it would be nice to possibly usher in the cluster of year-end holidays with someone new of the opposite sex. But these Craigslist ads are always a little awkward. Still, I guess it's better than trying to run my shopping cart into that of that cute gal in the produce section of Safeway. My luck, she'll be a personal liability lawyer and looking to slap a personal injury lawsuit on me-- and having a boyfriend, to boot. ("Clean up in aisle 9, please!")

I am an energetic, intelligent, single white male with a good heart and a sense of whimsy. Sensible and responsible, people find they usually can depend on me. I am single, 5'8", of medium build, and living in Sunnyvale. I only smoke when set on fire and my idea of buying crack is hiring my local plumber. At 58 yrs it seems that my youthful appearance, attitude and energy sometimes fool people (although in "dog years", I should be dead!), so for now, I think I'll continue tossing those AARP advertisements in the trash. 

I enjoy the "usual suspects" that most do: movies, concerts, BBQs, traveling, as well as others not listed. While not a marathon biker or hiker, I do like to occasionally hop on the bicycle for a ride around town or a walk along a trail. But if going to a party, fine dining or a night in town is your speed, I am usually up for that as well. Adept in the kitchen, I can be trusted with handling sharp knives and hot surfaces without frantic calls to 911 or Poison Control. 

I don't want to rattle off a laundry list of "must haves", esp. it has been my experience that the women that I have been fortunate to have involved with in the past all don't fit the same mold. Rather, I can probably tell you what qualities I historically have related best with: innate sweetness and decency; intelligence and common sense; a sense of humor and not taken to overly dramatic histrionics over small setbacks. Physically, I'm not particularly looking for Barbie, but I'd hope she'd not be three jelly donuts away from affecting the tides, either. In a perfect world, she would have a waist line smaller than mine.

Below are photos of me. Since I posted my photos for the entire world to see, it would be nice if you at least sent one privately. If any of this resonates with you and you think it might be worthwhile to initiate a conversation, feel free to drop me a note. And to separate the real responses from the "spam bots" that want to sell me sell me pornographic webcam links, Viagra or male enhancement aids (I hope I'm not the only guy getting these!), please put the words "Welcome 2016" in your subject line.
