title: 21 things you should know before dating me
text:
Get comfortable... this really *is* a list of 21 things you outta know before dating me...

Bars and clubs are not places I go to relax or meet anyone new. I drink very little and unfortunately have even less dancing talent... so if I end up in either place it's to talk with friends and or listen to the (live) music. Watching the sunset, soaking in a jacuzzi or going for a walk or are far more effective ways of relaxing than drinking in my humble opinion. 

While I admit it would make for some hot sex, if you are a Republican it's probably best that we never meet. 

 I've bullshitted my way around the fact that I can't dance my whole life. It's something I feel I've missed out on in life so despite feeling about as graceful as an elephant, I've been taking lessons starting with basic ballroom stuff with a desire to work my way towards other more contemporary styles. So if you're scared out of your mind to ever think of dancing like I was/am but are open to trying it out, or are an accomplished dancer, (not just ass grinding) it'd be great to have a partner to practice with! Note: This is not "code", I *REALLY* do want to get the steps down!

On the whole, looks rank far less than personality and intelligence. That said, most of you reading this, like me, could stand to be in some better shape... True for both of us, the closer to in shape the better. For me, I regularly play soccer, go for extended hikes and from time to time swim... if you're not already naturally slim, you MUST be a willing active participant in something athletic. Or better still, join me! :-P 

It is exceedingly difficult for me to maintain a close intimate relationship with a girl that does or ever did drugs, or smoked or is excessively religious or obese. Yes, I know... ouch, right? If you hate me for this, this should be proof enough to you that anyone is not for everyone. So why spend all the extra effort to give me a piece of your mind when your anger only underscores the point??? And yes, even though I voted to legalize marijuana, I'd prefer to find someone to date that hasn't ever done it... I know, a lonely life I will forever live... at least in California, right? 

Christmas = Santa Claus. Easter = Easter Bunny. Church = faking illness and watching football on TV or going to the beach. Side note about religion... it is a funny thing... it justifies lots of things, blamed very little for why crap doesn't go the way you want it to though. :-/ 

I may look at big boobs on girls, but I find smaller boobs much more attractive and have a longer shelf-life. 

I like kids. I want kids. Just not YOUR kids, right now.

I have an obscenely high credit score.

I will NEVER ask you to do anything sexual. Having to ask is pretty much like doing it myself but with half the satisfaction and twice the mess. So, with that said... some lazy weekend morning/afternoon that would be as good a time as any to give my penis some extra attention in some way that pleases us both. 

I will *never* attempt anal on you... ever! Not that I think those that are into it are bad or anything... I'm all for the kinky... just not the wiping of shit off my dick. 

If you love your dog/cat/animal, fine... but being "in love" with it is just creepy and kind of gross. I always thought of myself as someone that liked animals quite a bit until I dated someone that used their poor little dog as a child/barbi doll surrogate! 

I look younger than I am. Some day it will catch up to me, but for now... at the risk of a full blown rant, it*sucks*!!! It's different when you're a girl and look younger, and no, we're not talking that I look 12 or anything weird like that... but my biggest gripe is that "age appropriate" women (in the eyes of most of society) almost without fail seem to develop a "thing" about how "old" they look in relation to how old I look. Despite anything I say or do, it first chafes and then grinds on the insecurities of a lot of women and then it's just a downward spiral soon after that... :-/ As for younger women that *look* age appropriate (in the eyes of most of society) it also sucks forever being in a perpetual "trying-to-find-myself-have-daddy-issues" parade. Sure, age is just a number, but it's been my experience so far that younger women tend to be generally unaware/unappreciative and perhaps are just unequipped to reciprocate simple care, affection and intimacy beyond just sex. Hey, sex is great... but... despite what your high school/college boyfriend convinced you was the case... it really isn't the only thing a guy is looking for! 

Yes, there are times I am a little bit cocky and sometimes it borders on being a little arrogant. Having the ability to tactfully put me in check as needed is appreciated!!! 

Two truths one lie... think you can guess which is which? 1) I'm a certified lifeguard 2) Big fan of hiphop, jazz and big band music 3) I was once chased by an angry monkey 

There's no such thing as a free lunch... if I cook for you, don't tell me it's "good" I'm forever trying out new stuff and from what people that have tried what I make have said so far, I'm getting quite good at it. What'd be really useful is for you to give me a little feedback about why it's good, or why it's bad. You offering to help clean up is nice, but not required.

The term "racial" didn't mean anything to me until after I was 14 year old. Where and how I was raised "race" issues never came up because everyone was mixed up with everything else. I don't understand people that are hung up on racial bullshit. Fact, if you're an asshole, you're an asshole no matter what color you are! 

Sometimes I snore, not so often though.

I studied the German language in high school and the Japanese language in college. "Why Japanese?" is the single most often question I'm asked after people find this out. The answer comes in four parts: 1) I can't deny the food is healthy and great! 2) The lack a strong religion component to the culture that gets in the way of anything I want to eat or how or when I have sex. 3) The vast majority of the women are intelligent, multilingual and have never even seen drugs let alone took them and rarely smoke. All of these things I tend to find extremely attractive in a potential girlfriend! Ah yes, let's not forget number 4) No one expects a doofis like me to be able to speak Japanese which was never the case whenever I spoke German. "Asian fetish" you are thinking? Nah, I really don't care... see #17 for further guidance. :-)

In high school, I received as many "A"s as "F"s... graduated with a C average... somehow.

I dream of a day where all feminine hygiene products, pregnancy testing kits, toilet paper and erectile dysfunction advertisements are no more! That said, when it comes to any of these things, I would have no qualms about picking them up for you should the need occur. 



BONUS
 Congrats on getting all the way through this... So you read my posting and think I could be an interesting guy to meet up with... GREAT! To help separate the real people from the copious amounts computer generated spam, and people that are, "just bored" don't just "one line" me... Tell me a little bit about yourself! If you don't know what to say, please answer this one question: What was the last thing you did that made you smile? For those of you that respond with something interesting and insightful you can expect a quick reply... For those that also include a picture that accurately depicts them you can expect an even faster reply... or not! It'll all depend on what you say, and what if anything you send with it. Unfortunately for us all Love is a fickle Mistress like that. ;-/

title: How about a few strings attached
text:
Not looking for anything long term, and not necessarily ruling it out either. How about something in between? 

I've always been a one woman man, so am not really all about casually hooking up with lots of randoms ...much more interested in finding one person whose sexual chemistry clicks with my own and then letting things roll from there. 

I work waay more than is healthy. I own a small business that's finally started to take off after years of hard work, but unfortunately that also means I don't have the time or the ability to throw myself into a full relationship. However I do find myself missing the great sex that only comes with a LTR, and am looking for someone who feels the same. 

A steady wild-sex date then? A weeknight or two when work schedules allow, something much longer and more relaxed on the weekend when time isn't an issue? 

Bring your 'A' game and I'll bring mine. I love sex but love the slow smoldering build-up to sex just as much: 

Whether that's heading out into the muddy Regional Parks for a rainy-day hike, getting nice and dirty, before returning to clean up and get dirty in a whole different way. 

Or grabbing a quick drink to break and ease the tension of a long workday, and then working the rest away in a much longer and more intense manner
Or staying in to watch a movie or binge television, slowly losing articles of clothing as things heat up. 
....... 

At 41, I think my palette is a little more refined and my mind a lot more fun and dirty than anything that could ever come from a one night stand. 

I don't really have a ton of hang-ups, love my family, got over all my mother issues years ago, will treat you with all the respect you deserve outside of the bedroom, and as much as a sexy slut at you crave, inside it. I don't have any religious sexual guilt and am pretty non-judgmental when it comes to sex and fantasies. There are some things I'm not really down for but have always been willing to listen and figure out some kind of fun compromise that makes us both happy. 
Basically I look at sex as an incredibly fun activity, that only works if both people are really into it, and even if you're shy about telling me all (or any) of your fantasies, I look at it as my roll to keep throwing out kinky and not so kinky ideas until I figure out exactly what you like, what role play scenario fits your mood on a given night 

That's all well and good you say, but now get to the most important part: just what the hell do you look like?! 

I'm 6'2" and fairly fit build, (215lbs), somewhat disheveled blonde hair (has a mind of its own) and a short beard. Blue-gray eyes, strong hands, swimmers build (been doing more trail hiking than swimming in the past two years but can't really split hairs and the water is where I love to be) 

Personality wise I like to think I'm pretty easy going. Can see the humor in most things and spend most of my non-working time roaming the regional parks (both the East Bay and Marin) with my dogs (along with slowly fixing the wrecked Victorian home I bought in Berkeley years ago) I love the outdoors and all things wild (camping sex is some of the best sex ever! Snow camping even more so because there's pretty much nothing else to do) 
I do work way too much, which makes it a challenge to coordinate schedules with someone who is equally busy, but this is a priority to me, and at this point in life I'm (hopefully) evolved enough to not revert to a hurt little boy if I don't get my way, or you're not available every time I'm randomly free (although it defeats the purpose if we are both so busy all the time that we never actually see each other)

I don't smoke, don't use drugs, drink occasionally ...I'd say if harder drugs were your thing we probably wouldn't be that compatible, but otherwise those things don't much bother me one way or the other

Inside the bedroom I'm pretty dominant. I'm good at figuring out what someone likes and craves, and then using that to push boundaries. You can't really shock me, the kinkier the idea, chances are, the more I'll encourage you to share more.

I'm not looking for any specific type. You should be relaxed and have a sense of what you want and what you like. Age-wise I've always felt the ten year up/down rule worked best but that's not set in stone, body type/race isn't really a factor either, chemistry isn't something that can be defined. It's either there or it's not, 

Ideally someone local to the inner east bay would be preferred, I've done the FWB thing over distance and it's always much harder to do spur of the moment, which is kind of the point. Someone who likes the idea of coming over to fuck just to take the edge off, then doing something fun, and returning for an even longer more draw out round two.
Someone who wants the great sex that comes with a long-term relationship, without the expectations or demands on time (and often jealousy when that time isn't always available) that comes with a long term relationship. 

All that only works if we're also friends, so hopefully some of my personality shines through in what you've read, and if you think you feel compatible send me an email and photo and tell me why, along with what your are after and what you like

In order to weed through the scammers and robots please change the title to either your favorite East Bay Regional Park, or tv show ...no you won't be judged, for me there are lots to choose from but I really enjoyed the first two seasons of Fargo and love hiking (day or night) at Point Pinole

title: I'm not looking for this. . .
text:
Girls who use "lol" in their emails, or animated smiley faces. Am I in the seventh grade? Do you have a Hello Kitty pencil case? 

Girls who write "I'm bored at work." Then WORK! Unless you are manning a first-strike nuclear silo and have to sit around all day waiting for the end of the world, get off your IMing, smiley-face-happy ass and get to work. 

Girls who write "I'm bored at home." Then go volunteer somewhere. Or better yet, go back to work! 


Girls who, when asked what they are up to, reply: 
"Just watching TV, lol." 

Girls who, years after graduating college, nee high school, are still reading celebrity magazines... unless you are a media publicist... which also means you're an anorexic coke-head... which on balance sounds kind of fun actually. Write me! 

Girls who, when asked about hobbies, respond "I like to shop, hang out, go to the movies." Those are not hobbies, those are things to do when it's raining and the coke runs out. 

Girls who can spend hours talking about the plot twists and character developments of TV shows, but couldn't tell you the last book they read. 

Girls who, when remembering what the last book they read was, say "Ohmygod, THE DAVINCI CODE! It was, like, such a mindfuck." 


Please note the above, in its entirety, is meant for entertainment purposes only. Please don't freak out and blitz me with emails telling me what a bad person I am. Just trying to bring some much-needed humor to Craig's otherwise very helpful site, and perchance find a cute girl while I'm at it. 

50-56

title: Sincere and looking for LTR
text:
Hi
I know there are Craigslist romance success stories out there. I'm sure there are many of you, including myself who would like to find love too. Maybe like you, I have tried different websites without much success. I'm not the type to quit so I thought I'd try using CL this time.

I am making a serious attempt looking for a good match for a long term relationship. Why? Well for one I have been single for the last 18 years. I have enjoyed singleness but I do miss having a partner for many reasons. I am also middle aged and know that if you have a partner, we can both extend our life years. More often my friends are too busy or unavailable to do things so I do or go alone. It would be nice to have a partner who can go for coffee, a day trip or a weekend vacation at moments notice.

Middle-age dating is not easy especially on the web. For me its a bit too high-tech and I am more of a traditionalists, old fashioned romantic person. Web dating is like shopping for cars looking at make, model and year. What would be your car profile?

So, I'm not trying to write a book but if you kind of get where I'm coming from, drop me a note without a photo. I am not a photo collector but tell me more about you. I hope you have many interests and enjoy doing things as I do. And since you are not a Spambot, you can include your favorite ice cream flavor or car in the subject line.

Thanks and happy searching.

Note: I love the city and sharing this awesome photo by Lucas Saugen

title: Fully Functioning Yet In Deep Dispair? Me Two. Talk To Me.
text:
I read posts that speak of women describing how wonderful their life is, how they are surrounded by loving friends and family, how work is grand, how life is being lived to its fullest, and how there's just one little thing missing - a partner. Which, to boot, they don't really need, but it's a nice to have.

Wow - really?

Nonesuch is true here. My life isn't grand at all. I am not surrounded by a wonderful circle of loving family and friends. My work isn't necessarily fulfilling, and by no means am I living life to any fullest anything. Mind you, this isn't some depressionary confessionary - nottatall!

Rather, my family of origin are high maintenance mean peeps, so I'm not in touch much. I do have truly awesome friends, but they are few. But many people I deal with I find self-absorbed. It almost seems to be a ailment of our times. Combined with being soooo busy, folks seem to be increasingly unable or unwilling to perform altruistic acts. Anyhoo - my truth is that I am too lonesome in the ways that count for me, I spend more time alone than might be good for me - and I do so because I find a lot of people exhausting - they are work to be around. In part, because so many pretend so much. It's a lot of construction.

I also don't have some grand life plan, amazing vacations scheduled, bucket lists and new year's resolutions - not here. It's not that I am a hot mess ;-) or some sad sack of woe, but there's just no picket fence and dog in the wagon here. It seems we all keep it together and show up to each other pretending all's well. But it's not, and I know that's true for most others as well. What I wonder is: who then is the show really for? Maybe just for ourselves?

Well, if you can relate, holler. 

Age 30-50 give or take would be great. Connection matters more than numbers.

Real attractiveness would be swell. It's here ;-)

title: Missing Something In Your Relationshp??
text:

First, thank you for taking the time to read my ad, especially with how many are out there. Let me see if I can get close to describing your current relationship. You are either married or attached. For whatever particular reason or perhaps even a variety of reasons leaving the relationship you're currently in is not just an option. For the most part it is a good relationship, but the intimacy is lacking or non-existent, leaving you feeling unfulfilled. Alas, which is why you are here.

Perhaps you wish somehow you could stay in your current relationship, yet fill that void that currently exists? How close am I getting so far? If I'm close, we are in the same boat.....

I've been married for over 10 years and have one beautiful daughter that I simply could not bear to be without. For the most part my relationship is pretty good, minus the non-existent sex life. For a multitude of reasons, I cannot nor will not leave the relationship I'm in. Yet at the same time, I find myself longing to be physically desired by someone once again. 

If it sounds like we have something in common, feel free to write, I'd enjoy hearing from you no matter where it leads.

title: Can YOU Relate?
text:
I wonder how many others out there might be in a similar situation I'm about to describe? Perhaps you're dating someone or perhaps you're married. You may even have a home and children. Overall things are pretty good but for some reason the romance and passion in your relationship have seemed to have slipped away. You may or may not know why, but either way you find yourself wanting to feel desired once again. What do you do? You've brought it to their attention, yet nothing seems to improve or if it does, it's just for a short period of time.

Let's go a little farther. As some or many would tell you, just leave. However, that isn't as simple as they make it out to be. With a home, or children things are much more dynamic. So what to do then?

If that sounds familiar we already have something in common. I am married and have been for ten years now. We have one child together. I work full time and have a home. The passion in our relationship has slowly dwindled over time. It has gotten to a point where I've stopped being romantic or attempting to be physical with her because of constantly being rejected. It's hard to keep hearing No, because (fill in the excuse).

As I mentioned above, leaving is not an option for me. Some reading this might think otherwise and I respect your opinion. There is just part of me that feels empty for a lack of a better term and I'd rather not have it be that way.

What I'm looking for is someone who might be in a similar type of situation as I am in. I have no intention of taking you away from your partner/spouse. My hope is that the two of us might be able to fulfill a void we both have.

If I've piqued your interest or maybe you'd just like to exchange emails, feel free to write. I'd enjoy hearing from you no matter what you may be looking for.

Perhaps one day I might come across it. Perhaps not. Perhaps the possibilities may have come and gone for me.

I wonder if the magic spark can ever come back into my life? I often think about it...from time to time. Perhaps you might be thinking the same thing.

Being in my 30s, I have to admit, I have been truly in love in my lifetime and there is nothing like it. Simply nothing. 

It's funny but, it is finding that one person that when I look at her, words are hard to come out of my mouth. When I sit next to her, there is no need for words. Simply look into her eyes and two hearts feel it without one single word. 

The most astonishing things is, when we are married, it is so easy to see that women are interested in us but, there is nothing we can do about it ....The loyal ones anyway:)When you are divorced, things are very different. The questions I ask are interesting: 

Is it over for me? 

Is it even possible to find, rediscover and feel true love again in your 30s? 

Will my heart be able to trust again? 

Me? I am a happy, grounded, and content man. It would seem that I don't really need anything in my life. BUT, there is always that 'time', when I am alone that I think to myself, "could it be different'? I am stable, secure and most weeks, there are a couple of days I get lonely and find myself reading through these posts and wonder what it would be like to meet someone for a drink and get to know each other. I think about it each week and do nothing about it. Today, I am writing my thoughts on here. 

What kind of woman do I truly adore? I love my woman to be...

- She loves to show physical affection, is romantic, playful, and emotionally available 

- She is well educated and a hard worker, financially secure

- She has high integrity and believes honesty is the only policy, his word is SOLID... She is NOT into deception

- She is spiritual or believes in God but is not a fanatic . . . 

- She longs for and craves her man to notice her and spend time with her and holds her hand. Stares into his eyes...

- She is truly compassionate and very caring 

- She is 30-early 50s (PLEASE respect my age request), Caucasian, European, Asian attractive, fit, classy, slender...... (It's what I am attracted too)

- She is 100% SINGLE and COMPLETELY over her last relationship, loyal to me.... as I am to her

- She knows how to balance a relationship between her kids, work and her man. 

- She is not afraid of commitment and is looking for a life partner...

- She doesn't have to be perfect...I am not either

She is my dream. She has been my dream for a few years however, I ask God to help me somehow, someway, bring her into my life, slowly, gently, most beautifully and most understandingly. 

If you took the time to read this dreary yet emotional outpouring, responses are not only welcome, they are desired.

Me? I am masculine, attractive, muscular, caring, low key yet passionate, financially secure, well educated and have traveled a lot both here and overseas. I am spiritual, spontaneous, non-materialistic, down-to-earth. I am into fitness and healthy living but I am not a fanatic. I would like to be a great addition to someone's life. Especially if you are close to your parents and children. My family lives out of state and sometimes, that makes things pretty hard not being around them. 

Whoever you are. . .Thank you kindly for reading. I hope I touched one heart that is in the same place as mine. Although we may never meet, there is a tiny chance, we will. If these words resonate with you and you answered 'yes, that's me', to my little wish list, then we really should chat here.

I leave you with one last thought......One heart. With so many people in this entire world, why, oh why is it SO hard to find our ONE HEART?... I don't want to give up on believing I can find you and you, me. When two hearts become one, there is NOTHING like it in our life time.

I realize my posting is long and only the kind of woman I'm looking for will actually read it and respond thoughtfully...please give me a glimpse into your intellect and spirit. Please be courteous and respond with a recent photo of your face. If I reply, my message will include the same. I will only reply if I believe there's resonance and potential compatibility at different levels. No indecent pics. Not looking for sex here, so don't waste your time sending sex requests. 

Don't believe in long distance relationships, so Please be within 30 miles of the South Bay. 

I will continue posting until I feel comfortable meeting the one. We can exchange a few emails and then plan to meet. Please put your favorite food in the subject line to weed out the robots.

title: Like girls? Attractive guy seeking girl open to play with other girls.
text:
Recently moved back to the City from, well, lets just say a more conservative and much less adventurous part of the country. When I last lived here I had a female "friend" with whom I had a pretty stellar arrangement. I like girls, she liked girls (and guys), and of course I like girls who like girls. Now that I'm back in looking for an open minded, sane girl to date in a sort of quasi-conventional relationship who is also open to occasional play with another girl too. I've gone the conventional route, meeting girls at bars and the like, but the ones that have been open to this sort of relationship have been eager have also been... well, undesirable. As to the desirable ones? Well, here's hoping they're on CL.

A bit of a strange request, I know, but I figure there's got to be someone intelligent, attractive, and looking for/open to the same thing out there, right?

In addition to the above, you should be 20-30 or so, fit, fun, adventurous and open minded.
I'm tall, witty, intelligent. Athletic, attractive (well, some of that is open to your impression, I guess), well adjusted, maybe even a little old-fashioned (hard to believe with a post like this, I know). Straight. Drug and disease free, non-smoker.

Please send at least one photo, a good physical description, and any experience you have with this sort of thing (no experience is OK too, just be honest). Would love to get together for coffee or drinks sometime soon.

title: DATE 2 ,Coffee , A Drink , Movie
text:
2016
I wonder if the magic spark can ever come back into my life? I often think about it........from time to time. Perhaps you might be thinking the same thing. 
Being a Single Latin Dad, I have to admit, I have been truly in love in my lifetime and there is nothing like it. Simply nothing. six five owe eight one four two six one two 
When a single parent goes year after year and doesn't somehow, someway stumble across someone , it feels like time is slipping away. 
My life is ok work, gym , eats , some sleep.. hugs, of course is missing however, if one really wants and needs that, it can be had...
Its funny but, it is finding that one person that when I look at her, words are hard to come out of my mouth. When I sit next to her, there is no need for words. Simply look into her eyes and two hearts feel it without one single word. Is it over for me? 
Is it even possible to find, or rediscover, and feel love again .
Is touching her going to be just as incredible as it once was in my life? 
Will my heart go nuts with a simple kiss? 
Will she have that effect on me?............Desire. 

How do we find that one? I Love dating.. When we were younger, it was SO easy to meet then let things all fall into place. Now, we put up all sorts of obstacles. 

My dream is to one day meet a female at a coffee shop and I find the courage to say, "excuse me, you are really pretty and I am finding it hard not to say anything". Would she smile, would she tell me where to go or would she simply look at me as if I was a ok? 
Do we go to a bar and flirt? Do we go to a restaurant and chat? Do we post something online? Do we try Internet dating? Who the heck knows? 
Me? I am a happy, well grounded, and content Dad. It would seem that I don't really need anything in my life. BUT, there is always that 'time', when I am alone that I think to myself, "could it be different'? I am stable, secure and most weeks, there are a couple of days I get lonely and find myself reading through these posts and wonder what it would be like to have someone come over for a drink and get to know each other. I think about it each week and do nothing about it. Today 2016 I am writing my thoughts on here. Obviously, there is a gap in my life. I have no clue what to do or how to do it........ I mean, filling that gap. 
What kind of Female do I truly adore? Being honest, that is easy for me to share: I love my female to be........... 
Stunning in my eyes both inside her heart and outside.... 
Extremely kind hearted, spiritual, and LOVES to feel true love........ 
Incredible at listening and communicating with everyone she comes into contact with.....
She loves and adores her family and ALWAYS puts them first..... 
She is well educated and a hard worker who sets goals and achieves them... 
Her integrity is through the roof and her friends/peers respect her..... 
She is down to earth, self-confident and can hold her own in any given situation.... 
as hers do
someway, bring her into my life, slowly, gently, most beautifully and most understandingly. 
True love. Is it still out there for those of us who are single ? 
If you took the time to read this dreary yet emotional outpouring, responses are not only welcome, they are desired.
I am ready to open up a part of my world that I closed off after my time in the USMC . Why did I do that? I am not sure . A relationship at times doesn't seem possible BUT, if two people can start off with a deep desire to see each other once or even twice a week, that alone is so much better than not at all or sitting at home thinking about it. 
Just thoughts and desires. I have often thought about using a dating site but have not done that. If you have done that and had success, please let me know which ones to try. I would like to be a great addition to someone's life. Especially if you are close to your parents. My family lives in another State and sometimes, that makes things pretty hard not being around them. 
Thank you for reading. I feel pretty nice getting my feelings out.As a Military Guy in The Marine Corps we are thought not to talk about stuff like this but I feel free now and I am to be able to write this , Although we may never meet, there is a tiny chance, we will. If you answered 'yes, that's me', to my little wish list, then we really should chat here. 
I am spiritual, spontaneous, ambitious yet non-materialistic, and truly try to seriously achieve all my goals. I am attractive, slender, caring, passionate, well educated and I have traveled a lot both here and overseas. I feel I have lots to offer the right female. So, to wrap this long thing up, what am I sure about? 
I hope one day to be wrapped up in someone's arms that I don't want to be without. When we ask ourselves one question, we get all the answers we need. That question is simple: Imagine my life with her in it. Now imagine my life without her in it. Which? 
Thank you kindly for reading. I hope I touched one heart that is in the same place as mine.
I leave you with one last thought......One heart. With so many people in this entire world, why, oh why is it SO hard to find our ONE HEART?
I don't want to give up on believing I can find you and you, me. 
YESTERDAY IS HISTORY , TOMORROW A MYSTERY, AND TODAY A GIFT. Adam R. A Romantic Latin adam95008atyahoodotcom

title: Are your standards too high?
text:
Is it possible?
I don't know you.
Only after looking in your heart of hearts can you find the real answer.

As I browse through all the ads people place looking for that special someone, I have realized that with each listed request, one lessens the chances of ever meeting someone because they didn't meet someones expectations for one, or for many reasons. What's sad is I'm willing to bet there are a lot of people out there who would be great together if expectations were lowered only slightly.

One expectation I'm talking about in particular is being "fit".

When I read that a lady is looking for someone "fit", my mind always thinks of the male models you see, complete with six pack abs and the perfect tan, or "Dr. Mc Hottie" on Grey's Anatomy.

In all seriousness, if anyone looked like that, there's a slim chance they would be on CL looking for romance. Either that, or they would deliberately post their photo, then pick and choose through all the replies they received. That's taking into consideration anyone actually believes that was really them in the photo.

Similarly, when I read that a woman is "fit", I immediately think of women in skimpy bikinis with no body fat, and would expect nothing less than a male counter part with the same appearance.

Personally, if you're not one, you shouldn't be looking for the other.
In other words, if you're looking for Prince Charming, you really shouldn't be looking for Cinderella, (or the other way around) otherwise one of you is going to be very disappointed. 

I have read so many ads where people are looking for other "fit" people, and for me that's what makes me hit the back button and not reply. Despite everything else being a perfect match.

I could stand to lose some weight (can't we all), but I don't consider myself "fit" as I am 250 pounds, so because I would never want to misrepresent myself to someone on such a classy forum where everyone is just so darn honest. (yes, that was sarcasm) I tap the back button.

Some people (such as myself) simply need to be motivated because they don't see them self as a good enough reason to do it. 

Anyone that's had a hottie as a boyfriend knows they're easy to find, but very hard to keep. But just imagine how loyal someone would be if you put time and effort into them to make them what they've become?

They'd only have eyes for you, because you'd both have history together, and he would know that you were the reason he looks the way he does. And that he's all yours.

Ok, that last paragraph would only apply to me, as I'm not qualified to speak on other men's behalf. :)

There are so many "diamonds in the rough" out there, where all that's "wrong" with them is they are not "fit". When I was at my goal weight, you would be the one that reaps all the benefits of the diamond in the rough that now gleams in all their sexy splendor, and all your friends that were all giggling in the beginning are now drooling at the end, wishing they had the vision you did by seeing the end result before it actually happened.

And that that hunk of beefcake is all YOURS!

All it takes is a little foresight.

Let the hate mail begin! :)


Thanks for reading.

title: F**k the patriarchy
text:
If we ever expect to transcend THIS

We have to be ready and willing to change. But that's not enough. We also have to know how to change. That'll take architecture.

If you want to eat healthy, it means you must be capable of resisting the allure of the unhealthy. It does not mean eradicating what is unhealthy and making it unavailable to yourself. Not only is this scarcely possible, but it is also driven by a lack of self-control. Where one lacks self-control, one must develop it or suffer the consequences.

The world we live in today is a consequence of such lack, at a large scale.

If we wish the world to change, we must be the change. Those on the leading edge of that world-change must be capable of "eating healthy," so to speak, in the presence of "junk food," so to speak. Those who follow will find their way made easier by those who lead. Those who are last to adopt this change will find their way exceedingly easy and well-forged, but these will be last to adopt the change because they themselves have clung to the unhealthy. Often such ones only change because remaining in the old ways is just too hard.

We must also bear in mind the generational change - establishment tories will die of old age, and in their place, their children will grow up. There is always some manner of rift between generations. It's easier for the young to see the error of their fathers' ways, than it is for their fathers to see it. This is the seed of teenage rebellion. Sprout.

These young ones will have clearer minds with which to examine the "change" and make their own decision.

THE ARCHITECTURE

Requires an architect.

In the case of democratic global change, it requires many architects to work in harmony.

Our love of children is a reflection of our love of life.
Those who are cruel reflect a malignancy.
Those who wash their hands of children in pursuit of success.
Like a eunuch, they are not part of the flow of life, they watch from the sidelines. No biological contribution. All they have to contribute is material or philosophical, and these pass away.
The career-minded, who are these people? Nature did not create them, something else did. They created themselves in reaction to the establishment. Like donkeys, they do not breed, but they continue coming into this world. Why? The Establishment creates them, it takes our children, and turns them into the career-minded.

There are others who create themselves. They claw their way free of the Establishment's grip, and they turn militantly against its invasive use of force.

They establish their own guides and honor these with zeal.

I write all that stuff to weed out those whose heart doesn't light up at these thoughts. I write this because if it lights up something inside you, then we share something, and that's where I'd like to begin.

title: More Than a Paragraph, Less than a Book
text:
After surfing these ads for a few weeks, I've come to understand a few things.
I believe it's possible to find potential mates online. I've done it before with great results.

My last relationship, sourced from this site, lasted 8 years. It ended due to a series of catastrophic medical situations. We each were tested and grew beyond our comfort zones. It was real love, and for four of those years we hung in there for better or for worse. We evolved past living together, and we are on our own in lives very different from where we started. This happens, we learn to accept it, and move on. I wouldn't trade those years for any other.

It's not easy to follow a relationship of that depth with dating, but it's becoming more fun. It's clear what we are looking for. We want to be seen, heard, connected with on a heart level. We want to trust and be trusted. We want to have fun, to enjoy lightness as well as depth, to share our lives and ourselves. Only through trusting our senses will we be able to take the risks to meet at deeper and deeper levels, to join profoundly. Ultimately, we want to be accepted. . . and, we want to accept someone. 

Alone, we are complete. There is no absolute need to couple, to join with each other. We want to because we like the feeling of being part of something larger than ourselves. With another we amplify possibilities. Children, Grandchildren, the immediacy of Family are all more difficult alone. Yet, being intimate with another is as challenging as rewarding. The dynamics of attraction is mysterious. The list of attributes I find attractive and not do not necessarily describe or limit whom I've fallen in love with. The inherent risk at this point is putting it out there, dipping in the proverbial toe. It is as serious and focused an effort as our desire and passion. As well, it requires a sense of humor and a detached lightness to navigate the yeses and nos.

My profile is this length because I want this kind of relationship. The replies I return exhibit it has been read and understood, responded in like kind. Once in a while a short question or comment is so interesting I have to follow it back to you. This a new conversation, and counterproductive to remain for long in this virtual medium. Who we are is infinitely greater in person. If we interest each other, we talk and meet.

The normal stuff:

Handsome and healthy 65 year old man seeks an extraordinary woman in the North Bay Area.

I want a Partner, a Peer. You take good care of your physical self and those you love. You are intelligent and educated, even if you haven't advanced degrees, because you are learning all the time. . . it's what you do with experience. You may be well travelled and worldly, or you may have roots so deep you haven't needed to see that much of the planet. I grew out of the Man On Top world I inherited and with it the obligation to take care of you. You understand that I need flowers and want to be seduced as well since you've grown out of the Princess/Feminist paradigms. I will match you in all meaningful ways, surprise you at times, and appreciate what you bring to me. You are able to discern true wealth from false, truth from chicanery, and appreciate beauty within as well as without. 

I have an extraordinary life to share. I won't fix or transform yours, since you are living one of equal value. We are among the lucky, our lives want for little. We have worked hard to live well and have skillfully used the opportunities we were given. The synergy between our lives will generate a great deal of pleasure for ourselves, families, and communities. It will also create some challenging work for us as we get to know each other.

Extraordinary does not necessarily mean elaborate. . . sophistication is often simple, spare, refined. Maturity has brought a balance to the worldly as well as spiritual aspects of life. We aren't old yet, but clearly entering our elder age, and there's plenty of it left for each other. Though we constantly refine our habits, they are highly functional and have freed us to enjoy the mundane rather than be mired in it. We are engaged in life, not high or low on it. You likely have long term friends, a wonderful family you enjoy often, and work that energizes and fulfills you. You don't need me, you want me, as I you.

Though I revel in silence and solitude in my work and art, I am blessed with an abundance of life energy and am a very social person. I am shamelessly gregarious in good company. You will have to know who you are, what you are feeling, and be able to express those qualities in real time to handle me. You will always know what I feel and where I stand even if you don't agree. I will always respect your reality if it's authentic.

Basic Parameters:

5'-8"+, athletic build, Italian American
Energetic, Fit, and weight appropriate body
Active Life, inside and out, indoors and outdoors
Father of 2 beautiful daughters, Grandfather of 4
Personal Spirituality, Catholic childhood
Racially Open
No Smoking
Social Drinking
BA+, Architecture, Artisan Builder
Retired but active in Business

title: Seeking my Punk Rock Love
text:
I've been single for about a year now, finally got over my ex and looking for a new spark. I would like something long term like my last relationship of 2 years. I want something forever though. I do have friends who I care for and love. But I want someone nearby. I am a bit clingy and needy but it's from being broken from my past relationships. I suffer from PTSD and I will share my story with whoever wants to know about me. I will not share via email, it will have to be in person. Perhaps over coffee.

I'm currently in between jobs and constantly looking. I am outgoing, social, I drink occasionally, I smoke often and drink lots and lots of caffeine. I am a dog person and cat person. Prefer cats.

I am proud to have been born and raised in the East Bay, but I want to move to the South Bay. I've lived in the North Bay, Sacramento and all over the East Bay. I don't ever want to leave the Bay Area but I need to find a new groove. 

I like to play guitar and I'm trying to get back on my skateboard. Just so I can be in shape. I restore classic cars and muscle cars, mostly as a hobby, but I would love to do it as a career.

A few friends and myself are starting a psychobilly/horror punk band. Now I just need to learn how to give myself a Pompahawk. 

My favorite kinds of books include, but are not limited to; Sci-fi/Fantasy, Comedy, Mysteries, Murder Mysteries and Thrillers. My favorite movies and shows follow in those same categories. My favorite kind of music is Punk Rock, Psychobilly, Rockabilly, Blues, Horror Punk, Ska, Ska-Punk, Jazz, Classical, Classic Rock, Oldies and occasionally old school hip-hop.

I spend a lot of time thinking about my life and where it's headed. I try not to think about the past, but if it wasn't for my mistakes I wouldn't have known how to better myself for the future.

I spend my free time either watching Netflix, staying in and watching a movie, going out and seeing a movie, spending the evening with friends at a coffee shop or going to a concert.

I work at a haunted theme park every October at the fairgrounds in Pleasanton, Pirates Of Emerson, it's where the zombie pics come from.

I'm not really looking for anything but friends for right now as well as concerts buddies. I mean yeah, sex is great, but I'm not looking for that right now. I'm sure most of the asshole guys on here are saying that just to meet someone, but I have no reason to lie. I'm super fuckin honest, all the time. 

If you find yourself completely intrigued by everything you have read above or if you would like to know more about me, send me a message.

My dream date consists of, but is not limited to: glow-in-the-dark mini putt followed up by go-karts, the shooting range and watching the sunrise on the beach while cuddled under a blanket next to a bonfire.

Looking for the Bonnie to my Clyde.

Thank you for reading, if you made it this far.

title: "It is our CHOICES that show us what we truly are...
text:
...far more than our abilities."
*THIS POST IS MEANT TO INSPIRE AND PROMOTE CRITICAL THINKING*



Thought:

To think. Craigslist and the whole online concept in general...and who it attracts. How people go online expecting a relationship (something in general) from those they have yet to meet (and spend time with in person)....darn those wants and expectations. 
Perhaps they are the same people who treat relationships like "cell phones". Never being dedicated nor appreciative for what is because all the while, they're waiting for the next best thing to come around. Meantime, they drop 'm (mistreat) yet RAGE at the "phone" or blame "service" because it does not work? Unless you have Metro, that is a sign of some SERIOUS issues and lack of responsibility/reality.



Then you have the ones who "only got on here to laugh at articles" (so they say). Let's just buy into that stupid excuse. You mean to say that your life is so grand, so great...you are taking the time to "laugh at the others" who are doing something most are not willing due to fear of judgment? Which is what: Put yourself out there in an effort to find something??? (whatever that may be)

..........seriously, why make a simple thing so complicated....

You are here for a reason. So unless someone forced you against your will (for some psycho reason), don't play yourself. KEEP IT REAL! For it will help you find some depth/meaning with what you seek.



Now, don't get me wrong. Some of these craigslist postings are hilarious but those are people purposely crying for attention...in a unique way...very unique. But hey, I don't knock them for trying quite honestly. It isn't easy putting yourself out there even when you may not know what you are doing or ever been forced to look at yourself.

No one hands you a book with "How to put yourself out there on Craigslist" and even if someone did? Who is to say it would fit you perfectly? There is so much to every one of us...so I'd like to believe...so how else will you know unless you try?


I would like to believe there are some who take it seriously and genuinely trying to find something from nothing which is not an easy task. Most start online because the judgment and rejection is not something everyone can take nor handle...especially when it is in your face. Direction can be questionable with some being too critical, impatient, inexperienced and some being too careless. So many possibilities... Is the direction/meaning in hopes of some kind of happiness? Maybe. For some it can be pure boredom (attention of some sort), unfortunately.


We all have different views though, so...what is "happiness"? Do we all share the same definition? Have we ever had a taste of it and if so, was it real or was it a compromise?


Well, we haven't a clue of happiness if we've never been sad or down. And hey, we have our reasons for reading these things...and I'm sure they are along those lines. If not, we would be busy living life and doing our own thing far away from this chaos, right? But I'll tell you this, there many people out there who have never thought to think this way due to denial/fear of reality. So don't fool yourself thinking because they've never bothered that they are perfect. HAHA! ...no one is.


"Ignorance is bliss."


Most people seem to be distracted from what really matters. With television, internet and bad family/parenting (lack of guidance/positivity), things have just lost their meaning with time leaving lost people to make their own - forcing the blind to lead the blind.



So "Craigslister"... WHAT IN THE WORLD IS GOING ON AROUND HERE?! Eh, we can go on forever with that. But you...what do you search for... and why?


I have been on here for quite a while posting this. It is all in hopes it will encourage readers to seek some direction or....discover a kind of hope. Let's just say I'm a nice guy simply trying to help. Because to know what I do now and NOT share it? I wouldn't be who I am today if those who came across my path never shared their wisdom. We are all just people trying to figure things out; ourselves and this world around us just to find a "meaning".


Craigslist has shown me that those who like to read are the ones who are most willing to try (more often than not). But care? Understand? Comprehend? That all varies by perception and experience. That is where it is important to educate yourself and take on certain experiences that will benefit your mind/body.


Here is something else I've learned:
The majority of visitors on here are searching for the best bull sh...illusion ever. One that has been fed by advertisements, fashion, maybe even some (ignorant/immature) family/friends and the entertainment industry... PERFECTION!


All the while you're making yourself insecure at someone else's benefit, You're left confused/distracted. Chasing dreams rather than the meaning of them...and what they even mean TO you. We care about what something looks like or what SOMEONE ELSE THINKS rather than what it's made of or how it makes one FEEL.


No one is perfect (that includes you & I) and the day you realize that, you will be one step closer to finding some sort of direction toward some sort of belief. After that will come happiness. Happiness will bring love from within but you gotta understand and find it within yourself. So don't go wasting your time on "looks" or "money" because time will diminish that...and what will you have then?


Understanding, compromise and respect are essential...and they truly start with yourself.


"You can't help me, if you can't help yourself."



Call me old school but isn't that what a relationship should be all about?

Helping one another? To help stay focused, on track, happy, healthy and being there for one another in hopes of betterment during hardships while keeping the other person's interests at heart? Or maybe better put: "Relationship: Two people who accept one another's past, supports the present and encourages the future."


I come to think of a partner as being in a "partnership". Saying, "I got your back and you have mine." Something... that took a genuine mutual belief that enriched bond or connection which fueled team effort in hopes of sharing one another's world (then a home) and prosper together.

Once that was accomplished, "traditionally" (not saying it's a MUST because kids are not objects nor does it make you "a real parent", "mature", "responsible", "respectable" nor "accomplished"), they would then raise a child or two (seriously, if you have more kids than you have hands, you have problems or you are a freak) to share what they have found in life. To keep that...that "fire" alive or pass something down? Maybe that is Disney stuff.


Again, not to say you NEED to have kids to be "respectable" or "accomplished", not at all. Honestly, many are not meant to have kids and best if they don't. I really respect those who acknowledge and make that choice. I feel finding someone you can grow old with and be genuinely happy is key. And that should not have to be "justified" or proven by marriage or kids. It should be by the effort and time together with all happiness to show for it every day possible.


...goodness! Sounds like a lot of work! But as they say (don't ask who is "they"):


 "When you love what you do, you never work a day in your life." 


Love, in my opinion, is about appreciation, not possession. So if you NEED to get married or have kids to feel validated? Something is seriously wrong and really must take a look in the mirror. 


Murphy's law:  "Anything that can go wrong, will go wrong." 



Maybe I have it all wrong. But what I do know and have right from experience, is that if you want something meaningful and amazing? It takes time, trials, effort and strong communication on both parts. Dedication that should blossom into passion. And anything that is fast and easy, is more than likely not worth having because everyone would have it. And if anyone can have it, I'm not sure if it'd be THAT special or meaningful. For anything worth having never comes easy.

So many people looking for "fast & easy" love...and look at where that has gotten most people? Welcome to single parenthood...thanks, mom & dad! (...it is always best to blame some on else...kidding but if there is anything, I blame marketing)



Dating will go as they come. If it's really fast... what can you expect other than it to leave just as fast?

(or be very fragile)



I wish everyone all the best and hope this all helps with some direction in your life. Because you came on and read these pages for a reason.


Note when reading these things:

The larger the post, the more you have to go by when you meet and see how full of shit they could be.

The smaller the post, you can expect the meaning to be just as insignificant (or spam).



Besides...it is better to say too much, then never to say what you need to say. :)



Want something real? Find out what that is and keep it real.
Because we all have hope. That's what TRULY brought you to craigslist. And when two people strongly believe in the same thing, that is called potential!


Just keep your head up or a good thing could pass you by for even I am still searching for my other half...I just had to know myself a whole lot better in order to get an idea of it. Weird though, because when I think about it? I never thought...that the other half of ME...has a vagina, haha! Maybe yours has one as well...that's cool too. Sucks for straight guys but hey, BE HAPPY!!


If you love what is true, the world will come to you but remember, it starts with yourself. And to take a look at yourself and make a change for the better is not easy, let alone accepting what needs to be changed but know you attract what you put out. Not all the time but: 

 "Real will recognize real." 


So don't be a fool placing "requirements", "limits" or "expectations" on love. Because love does not have a face nor eyes. It has a heart. It feels. And true love, is very similar to life. It's not something you "find easily" or ask for, it's given to you...out of no where. But ya better believe, it will take a whole lot of hard work and dedication which sadly, not many are willing to do.


 "Not anyone can be a great person, but a great person can come from anywhere." 





Thank you for reading. Much love and best of luck to everyone.





If you truly enjoyed this and would like to show support or keep up with more of these kinds of things to come (please be patient), feel free to look me up on book with faces and tube of you under "NESTOsterone".


I recently moved to LA to share all this in the form of stand up comedy so please be patient as I take my words of wisdom to the motherland of shallow!

title: divorced not broken
text:
I swear it would be easier to win the lottery than to find a woman on this site. I tried for months; I have found some interesting people don't get me wrong. I have also found a lot of shallow people here too. They are the ones who care about how much money you have in the bank or what kind of car you drive, your physical appearance. These women are looking for a status symbol men. They want men over 6 ft. They never get to know the person on the inside they judge within 30 seconds if they want you or not. Then when Mr. Pretty boy screws them over they get mad and say there are no good men out there. I am not bitter I just call it like I see it. I feel sorry for these women who pass up something good and don't even know it. I may be an average Joe. I am ok with it. I have a great career which I enjoy and I am the type of guy who helps everyone out because it is the right thing to do. I know who I am and I do not need material items to label me a catch. I was given a good moral compass from my upbringing. I know right from wrong. I know how to treat a lady. When I first came to California my first Girlfriend chastised me for opening a car door and pulling out a chair for her. I thought man something is wrong. Needless to say we did not last.

I guess I am looking for someone who will accept me for me. I accept that person for who she is. We all have baggage from child hood, past relationships, work issues that shaped us. Some of us still have not resolved the issues. Which I am ok with. Life is a process that some people wake up and say hey I am stuck in a pattern I need to change. Some do not. I have taken the time to get myself together after a dysfunctional marriage to a woman who was to busy being a daughter than to be a wife (I was told this by 3 different marriage counselors). I have taken my responsibility for my faults in that relationship. I learned from my past so I know I will not repeat the past. I feel in a relationship that it is ok to be different and have your own hobbies but also have things in common. So when you go out and do your own hobbies you can come home and talk to your partner tell her all about it and the same would apply to her. There are people out there that think that their spouse is responsible for their happiness, the key is you are responsible for you own happiness. If you are not happy than you cannot expect to have someone else make you happy( in general).We all have our ups and downs your spouse is there to help you to get you through the rough times and be there to rejoice in the happy times. title: Do you read The New Yorker?
text:
Do you read The New Yorker? If so, we already have one thing in common; but then, the critical question, drilling down to (potentially) the first whiff of compatibility is: How do YOU read The New Yorker? Here is how I read it.

I start with the weekly cartoon contest. I've entered a few times, never made it to the finals, and admired how much funnier the finalists' entries were compared to mine--and love seeing the entries for cartoons for which I couldn't think of anything funny (the vast majority). Next it's Shouts and Murmurs. From there to the latest movie reviews, then working backward through reviews of books, plays, dance and music. Then Comments and forward through essays, reporting, poetry and fiction. And finally, skipping the letters to the editor, Goings on About Town (in case I find myself visiting my hometown).

If this resonates, and think you might be interested in meeting the highly educated swm who wrote it, drop me a line! Getting a photo would be very nice (and I'll send you mine). 

Please put my way in the subject line.

But most importantly, tell me how YOU read The New Yorker.

title: Seeking Soul-Mate for integral love relationship
text:
Hello,
I am seeking/attracting my soul-mate, equal co-creator, and life-partner who feels passionate about co-creating and promoting healthy, sustainable love relationships as the foundation for a peaceful and sustainable future for all humanity, and who resonates with the values below:

We choose to love instead of something that happens to us or that we attract.
We transcend our primary fantasy and base our relationship in Being values, versus material,
sexual, or emotional neediness.
We see the depth of our heart and soul connection as well as the level of humility and devotion to our relationship as an indicator of our psychological health and spiritual realization.
We use our relationship for ongoing mutual learning, healing, growing, and awakening towards the capacity to love unconditionally.
We hold an evolutionary perspective and have reached or strive towards an integral, transpersonal or higher level of consciousness.
We continually develop, balance and harmonize our healthy feminine and masculine polarities and meet each other as opposites and equals to create synergy at the level of all seven chakras.
We share a purpose in our relationship (co-creating and promoting "integral evolutionary love relationships) which is larger than either individual and offered in service for the greatest good of the largest number of people, while also preserving the relative sovereignty of each individual.
We make an explicit agreement to share our truths without the need for validation or acceptance from our partner, and to own our emotional reactions to our partner's reality.
We share material resources and pursue an environmentally and socially responsible and sustainable lifestyle.
We continually develop, balance and harmonize our healthy feminine and masculine polarities and meet each other as opposites and equals to create synergy at the level of all the seven chakras.
We have an Integral Life Practice (ILP) with modules for the health of our body, mind, spirit/soul, and shadow, as well as ethics, sexuality, work, emotions, and relationships.
We set and respect each other's healthy boundaries.
We engage in sacred/tantric sexuality and practice monogamy out of choice instead of fear.
I have a US and German Passport and can live/work anywhere in the US and the EU (with a preference for California).
Please contact me if you are concerned about the future of our planet and all its inhabitants and want to make a positive difference in the world, feel passionate about co-created healthy sustainable love relationships between equal and opposite partners with the same rights and responsibilities, integrate non-dual spirituality with social and environmental responsibility, are fit and healthy in body, mind, heart and soul/spirit, feel attracted to me, are financially stable (as I am), have (a) child(ren), are available to travel, and interested in living, developing and furthering the Integral Evolutionary Love Relationship vision in a co-created, devoted, caring, and passionate love relationship with me.

Warm regards, 
Martin

I like to beach camp in my tent trailer along the coast and do so every couple months in places like Bodega Bay, Wrights Beach, Gualala, Anchor Bay, etc. See photo above. I'm happy, friendly, honest, open, humorous and usually a lot of fun. In short, I'm a desirable man of integrity and wit. I like music, the outdoors, the coast, exploring, top-down country drives and picnics, and enjoy a glass of wine at the beach or coffee in a morning forest. Life's three most important activities: Breathing, eating and sex (not always in that order), four and five we won't talk about here. 

Life is but a mere blip of light between two dark eternities. (My newest one)
To me, spending eternity in Heaven with people I don't like would be the same thing as going to Hell.

Homosapiens have the most complicated, involved and intricate mating ritual of any species on the planet (with the possible exception of the Borneo Bird of Paradise).
